text: Over the years my mom has become a self-taught Biblical scholar.
author: Kathie Lee Gifford

text: You can be good at technology and like fashion and art. You can be good at technology and be a jock. You can be good at technology and be a mom. You can do it your way, on your terms.
author: Marissa Mayer

text: Mom always tells me to celebrate everyone's uniqueness. I like the way that sounds.
author: Hilary Duff

text: He was doing - Ray was designing the clothes for my mom's show from California. And one of the first appearances I ever made on television was on my mother's show and Ray and Bob did the clothes for that. It has been a long time.
author: Liza Minnelli

text: Dinner 'conversation' at the Cohens' meant my sister, mom, and I relaying in brutal detail the day's events in a state of amplified hysteria, while my father listened to his own smooth jazz station in his head.
author: Andy Cohen

text: I saw things at an early age because my mom was a theater actress. I did a play with her when I was 10 years old.
author: Sam Rockwell

text: My mom always taught me to be sweet and polite and cross my legs because it's what the guys like. Actually, they like a raunchy girl once in a while.
author: Tiffani Amber Thiessen

text: Morality and its victim, the mother - what a terrible picture! Is there indeed anything more terrible, more criminal, than our glorified sacred function of motherhood?
author: Emma Goldman

text: I grew up in the '80s, and there was no bigger group than New Edition in R&ampB. I broke my piggy bank so me and my mom could go to a New Edition concert together.
author: Ruben Studdard

text: I was serious about ballet for a long time, but my mom got me into tap and jazz and modern and hip-hop, and I was one of those over-lessoned children.
author: Greta Gerwig

text: I'm named after a horse. My mom's best friend had a horse named Brooke, so my dad suggested 'Brooklyn' as a more formal version, and it just stuck - and now I live in Brooklyn part-time, so go figure.
author: Brooklyn Decker

text: I've been a pretty selfish mom and a very unselfish athlete for about three years now and it's time to put my family first. It's probably time to move on.
author: Melanie Roach

text: My mom had to beg the guys to let me play. I couldn't even play the drums right - Brian had to show me.
author: Dennis Wilson

text: Mom was the greatest influence of my childhood. She wanted to save me from the vice, lust, and drinking that was all about me.
author: Ethel Waters

text: My dad is a lawyer and my mom is an artist. So growing up was exactly what it sounds like - strict household but a lot of creativity. They are so psyched that I get to make music for a living. My parents rule.
author: Ty Segall

text: Sweater, n.: garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Being a mom makes me feel whole and like I understand the meaning of life.
author: Rebecca Romijn

text: I always wanted to be a young mom, but generations of women have worked so hard so we can have a career and wait to have children. So I say carpe diem - take advantage of that.
author: Brittany Murphy

text: I was actually the one who decided to move to LA. Mom and I were driving on Sunset Boulevard during one of our trips back to see her family, and I said, 'Can we just stay?' So we did.
author: Lily Collins

text: We're definitely a hodgepodge of influences. Mine, most heavily, would be Southern rock - the Allman Brothers, Lynyrd Skynyrd and stuff like that. Hillary is more from the country side - her mom is Linda Davis, a country singer. Dave, he's a big fan of the Eagles and like that.
author: Charles Kelley

text: Of course, I would be depressed sometimes, and my Mom would be worried about me because I would just sleep to escape. Cause I was so scared of being a musician or artist, or whatever you want to call it.
author: Chantal Kreviazuk

text: What mom cares about most is that I'm happy, healthy and enjoying my life.
author: Chaz Bono

text: Trying to be Supermom is as futile as trying to be Perfect Mom. Not going to happen.
author: Arianna Huffington

text: What makes me happy is just curling up in with my mom in her bed and watching a marathon of 'CSI' and 'Grey's Anatomy' episodes with pints of ice cream.
author: Taylor Swift

text: My mom was truly an iconic figure, a great journalist and a pioneering woman who died at 54 of cancer without ever having revealed to viewers that she was ill.
author: David Frum

text: My mom is like this hard-core, liberal feminist. She's a professor in Boston, and she's been teaching women's studies for 30 years and international politics.
author: Eliza Dushku

text: I was looking to do something non-fiction because I had done a strip, 'My Mom Was a Schizophrenic.' I really enjoyed the process of doing that strip, despite its subject matter. To do it I'd had to do a lot of research and reading and I figured I'd like to do that again.
author: Chester Brown

text: When I was a child it was very clear what I was allowed to see and what I was not allowed to see and there was no discussion or option or negotiation. Whatever my mom said, that's what went down.
author: Yul Vazquez

text: It is not until you become a mother that your judgment slowly turns to compassion and understanding.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: My house has always been like everyone's house. You walk in, you're a part of the family, no matter who you are, what celebrity status you are, everyone is treated the same - with love from my mom.
author: Vinny Guadagnino

text: The military infrastructure grew me. My faith in God is important, my belief in my country is important, my relationship to my family is important, the things that Mom and Dad tell you growing up are important.
author: Tommy Franks

text: I think my first big purchase was actually for my mom. She had one of those '90s TVs in her living room that's like a 10x10 brick, so I purchased her a flatscreen for her living room.
author: Dave Franco

text: I dyed my hair blonde when I was 14. My mom was not happy. But I love being blonde.
author: Rita Ora

text: I've always wanted to be a mom at 23, 24ish, ever since I was a little girl. I'm right on schedule.
author: Brandy Norwood

text: Married and divorced, three beautiful daughters, two in college. The other one is 16, lives with her mom. I'm 46, I've worked for the Post Office for 18 years, seven facilities in three states.
author: Arthur Godfrey

text: I usually travel with a lot of people, like my dad, mom and sisters.
author: Booboo Stewart

text: When I was 12 I cried to my mom, because I never got my letter to Hogwarts.
author: Sara Paxton

text: My mom introduced me to science-fiction.
author: Logan Marshall-Green

text: A friend of my mom's was a casting director so, really as kind of a lark, I had a couple of acting jobs that had just enough exposure to give me the option to continue if I wanted to. I followed through with it.
author: Ben Affleck

text: If I made a list of the people I admire, Mom would probably fill up half of it. She could do anything and everything.
author: Patsy Cline

text: Well, when I was a little girl we had 17 cats once. They all lived outside, and they kept having more kittens. My mom made us put little ribbons around each kitten's neck, put them in a wagon, and go door-to-door around the neighborhood to try to give them away.
author: Cheryl Hines

text: If you ever become a mother, can I have one of the puppies?
author: Charles Pierce

text: Everything I am is because of my mom.
author: Sarah Michelle Gellar

text: My mom was a big 'Smurfs' fan, so she would force me to watch every Saturday morning. I had no choice in the matter. I would jump downstairs on Saturday morning, 'Hurray, cartoons!' and she would say, 'Smurfs! That's what you're watching.'
author: Jayma Mays

text: In fact, my mom always told me because I was the daughter of an Army officer born overseas in Paris, France, that under the Constitution she believed that I could never run for president.
author: Karen Hughes

text: A Romney-Ryan administration will protect and strengthen Medicare, for my Mom's generation, for my generation, and for my kids and yours.
author: Paul Ryan

text: I want to be a mom who listens.
author: Tori Spelling

text: My parents and my grandfather on my mom's side would travel the earth. They went to Australia and China, and they went to probably every soccer game I ever played.
author: Brandi Chastain

text: For a kid who's lost his mom and all the rage and grief that no one was able to talk out of me, football was a very therapeutic sport. Very.
author: Jon Hamm

text: After my mom died, there was so much written about her fashion and her style and all that, and I felt that one of the most important parts of her was missing, her real intellectual curiosity.
author: Caroline Kennedy

text: I still feel like a kid sometimes myself so hard to believe that I'm a mom. Now I'm an adult! It only took 38 years!
author: Ana Ortiz

text: My mom used to tell me: 'It's not what you weigh it's what you look like.'
author: Gina Carano

text: I'm an actress and mom, and I probably don't have enough of an active spiritual life. And I don't know why people run around calling themselves by the names of religions when they don't actually practise them.
author: Uma Thurman

text: I think my mother is my biggest influence. There are so many things I hate about her but at the same time I'm thankful for her. All I know is that when I'm a parent I want to be just like my mom. I can talk to my mom more than any of my friends could talk to their parents.
author: Nikki Reed

text: My mom wasn't a movie star.
author: Jeff Bridges

text: My beloved Mom and Pop always rated tops with each other, and that's the way it will always be.
author: Ethel Merman

text: Before I was a mom I used to think that parents who worried about their kids watching MTV were just clueless. Now that I'm a mom, I see what the fuss was all about!
author: Martha Quinn

text: I know that I'm getting the real deal with my mom. I know that she's telling it like it is. She's proud of me when I've earned it and she's disappointed in me when I've earn that. She's really my spectrum on where I am as a person.
author: Lara Flynn Boyle

text: I was born in Texas and I lived there 'till I was 8. Then I moved to the Dominican Republic with my mom, lived there for two years and forgot every word of English I knew.
author: Michelle Rodriguez

text: I want to be as healthy as I can because I'm a mom now.
author: Jessica Simpson

text: My mother taught me to treat a lady respectfully.
author: Chris Brown

text: I spend so much time with my parents. My mom and I were joined at the hip for five years. There was not one moment when I wasn't with her.
author: Kay Panabaker

text: I'd lose my mind if I heard my kid call the nanny Mommy.
author: Toni Braxton

text: Being a mom is hard, I think a lot of working moms feel that way.
author: Gwen Stefani

text: What do girls do who haven't any mothers to help them through their troubles?
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: Becoming a mom made me more contentious about expressing my true taste.
author: Edie Brickell

text: There is nothing worse that a thirteen-year-old boy. You're embarrassed by your parents, and you're trying to find your independance because, deep inside, you are so dependent on your mom.
author: Ben Affleck

text: I am no mother, and I won't be one.
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: I want my daughter to be proud of me and look up to me. I think early on in my pregnancy I realized that to be the mom I want to be, I had to change my life, and that's what I'm doing.
author: Holly Madison

text: My mom was so people-friendly. She was incredible. She'd go to the mall, and she'd talk to everyone. Give people a kiss on the cheek. I think if I wasn't pushed around a lot, I'd be great with people. Maybe I still can be.
author: Fred Couples

text: I was thinking that when I have children, that I should always dress as a character for them, so they think their mom is Alice in Wonderland or Cinderella.
author: Gwen Stefani

text: I basically became a cheerleader because I had a very strict mom. That was my way of being a bad girl.
author: Sandra Bullock

text: I've realized how precious life is. When I was younger, I was more adventurous. I felt invincible. I was game for everything. As a mom, I don't want to get injured because then I can't take care of my kids.
author: Kristi Yamaguchi

text: My mom was always the support. I can always go out to her and she'll always find the positive in things.
author: Caroline Wozniacki

text: All of us kids ended up 'doing Mom.' There are four of us who've tried show business. Five if you insist on counting my sister the nun, who does liturgical dance.
author: Bill Murray

text: I really like Calvin Klein for his classic simplicity. I also think Prabal Gurung designs some great pieces that work well for me. My mom has such great style she's my biggest influence.
author: Isabelle Fuhrman

text: My mom and I are very close.
author: Lady Gaga

text: My mom obviously had a problem.
author: Dave Pelzer

text: I was labeled a troublemaker, my mom an unfit mother, and I was not welcome anywhere.
author: Ryan White

text: When love is gone, there's always justice. And when justice is gone, there's always force. And when force is gone, there's always Mom. Hi, Mom!
author: Laurie Anderson

text: I would make my mom buy me the toy doctor kit.
author: Debi Thomas

text: I'm sure that my mom would have been happy with any path I chose.
author: Joely Fisher

text: I'm more straightforward, and I speak up more than I did before. When I was younger, I wouldn't speak up as much, but now that I'm a mom, things have changed.
author: Britney Spears

text: Before becoming a mom, I never knew how good I had it to just spend time at a spa for a few hours. Now, those days are far and between. So when I have an hour, it's all about the mani and pedi.
author: Tia Mowry

text: My mom always said that there would be haters. Not everyone can love ya.
author: Joel Madden

text: The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: My mom used to make everything. She had a great garden and composted and made everything from scratch - peanut butter, bread, jelly, everything. I don't know how she did it because all those things take time and love and labour. I only do half the stuff she does - but there's still time.
author: Julia Roberts

text: Mothers send strips to daughters to make a point. Daughters smack strips down on the breakfast table to make a point. My own mom sometimes cuts a strip out and sends it to me to make sure I understand her.
author: Cathy Guisewite

text: No matter what, like, I couldn't - I could break a world record, get an Olympic gold medal, and my mom would be, like, you could have done better. But you looked pretty. That's what she says all the time.
author: Ryan Lochte

text: When I was 10 years old my mom used to play Tupac while she cleaned the house.
author: Soulja Boy

text: Growing up, my mom was very strict about how I dressed and how I behaved, and I said to myself that I wasn't going to be like that. But now I know I'm going to be exactly like my mom. I'm going to be worse!
author: Nicole Scherzinger

text: Mothers don't let your daughters grow up to be models unless you're present.
author: Janice Dickinson

text: My mom started smoking when she was 11. She went to the hill next door to try her first cigarette. She set the entire hill on fire, but it didn't deter her.
author: Loni Anderson

text: There is nothing better than being a parent. It is the most challenging job one could ever ask for. I love being a mom and I love being a friend to my children as well.
author: Marlee Matlin

text: Sometimes when my mom finds a fun article and really wants me to read it, I will. But I prefer to just kind of focus on what I want to do and not really what other people are saying, because I don't want that to affect me too much.
author: Missy Franklin

text: My mom's collard greens. No one else in the world can make them like hers. I'm not just saying that because she's my mom. She's got some Mississippi secret. I could seriously eat them every day.
author: Santigold

text: You eat and sleep it all day long and play on the streets until mom calls you in. My story is no different than anybody else's.
author: Adam Oates

text: Mom claimed that I could carry a tune at 2 or 3 years of age. Maybe she was a little prejudiced.
author: Ethel Merman

text: The fastest way to break the cycle of perfectionism and become a fearless mother is to give up the idea of doing it perfectly - indeed to embrace uncertainty and imperfection.
author: Arianna Huffington

text: For the first few years of my life my mom used to cut my hair so there were a lot of bowl-cut hair styles.
author: Ne-Yo

text: In her whole life Mom never earned more than five or six dollars a week. Being without a husband, it was hard for her to find any place at all for us to live.
author: Ethel Waters

text: I am very proud of my mom and consider her the most courageous woman I know. With perseverance, sacrifice and hard work, she raised a family of Olympic athletes and gave us the tools and the spirit to succeed. That is something that my brothers and I will always be thankful for.
author: Diana Lopez

text: It's hard either way, at home or on the bus, I think the hardest thing probably for me is going one second from being mom to right out on the stage and having to be that person too. It's hard to switch gears.
author: Lee Ann Womack

text: My mom listened to the Beatles and Elvis, a lot of different types of music.
author: Travis Barker

text: I told my mom I would graduate. I owe that much to her and myself.
author: Carmelo Anthony

text: I played with dolls until I was 15. My mother encouraged it because my older sister got married when she was 15, so Mom thought that the longer I stayed with dolls, the better.
author: Linda Evans

text: My brother Trevor is theatrically trained. I used to watch him when I was younger and I was in love with it. It just seemed really fun to be someone else. So I begged my mom she was hesitant, but she eventually allowed me. And it turned out well, I guess.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: When you have lost people like I lost my birth mom at a young age and you remember the whole process of losing her, you want to grab on to something that makes you whole.
author: Reese Hoffa

text: Yes, Mother. I can see you are flawed. You have not hidden it. That is your greatest gift to me.
author: Alice Walker

text: My mom would give me a piece to play, but I wouldn't do any theory because when it came time to do it I would sneak back upstairs and watch TV. So, I had these kind of nonchalant lessons for years, then it just started soaking in.
author: Vanessa Carlton

text: I was thinking that when I have children, that I should always dress as a character for them, so they think their mom is Alice in Wonderland or Cinderella. It would be totally messed up!
author: Gwen Stefani

text: I ask people why they have deer heads on their walls. They always say because it's such a beautiful animal. There you go. I think my mother is attractive, but I have photographs of her.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: My mom breastfed me for more than a year, and I can't imagine doing it any other way. It's cheap and much better for the environment, and you don't have to lug all that stuff around.
author: Emily Deschanel

text: My friends and I would get up early and take our horses through the national forest. My mom was very free. It was always 'Out of the house!' There was no watching television on weekends.
author: Anna Torv

text: From the very start of all of this, my mom has read the scripts first. And if she liked something, she let me read it. She told our agent what kinds of parts that we would want.
author: Anna Chlumsky

text: It's fun to play mom. Last I knew I was playing a 17-year-old who graduated.
author: Selma Blair

text: My mother was a personal friend of God's. They had ongoing conversations.
author: Della Reese

text: My mom is two people to me. She's my mom number one, and then she's this lady most comedians know as being a legendary owner of a nightclub that's responsible for starting a lot of heavy careers.
author: Pauly Shore

text: You know, I don't think any mother aims to be a single mom. I didn't wish for that, but it happened.
author: Charlize Theron

text: I loved raising my kids. I loved the process, the dirt of it, the tears of it, the frustration of it, Christmas, Easter, birthdays, growth charts, pediatrician appointments. I loved all of it.
author: Jane Elliot

text: I would go visit my mom on Sundays, and my brother was working on stuff. I'd go in there and sing a little melody, then we started working with words and the next thing you know it was just born organically without really trying.
author: Taryn Manning

text: My mom just understands about stuff. We have a really good trust, and she knows I can take care of myself.
author: Balthazar Getty

text: I wanted to have a personal life that I fully inhabited, not because I am such a great mom, but for me.
author: Helen Hunt

text: I grew up painting and playing piano so when I was a little kid I thought I was going to be an artist or a painter but my mom had me taking piano lessons for about 10-12 years as a young kid.
author: Mike Shinoda

text: My mom was definitely very strict with me.
author: Gloria Estefan

text: My mom brought me up to believe that my talent is a gift and a blessing.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: I love those hockey moms. You know what they say the difference between a hockey mom and a pit bull is? Lipstick.
author: Sarah Palin

text: My mom's a concert pianist, so she started teaching me when I was around seven. When I was eight, I started writing my own songs, and kinda started putting piano and singing together. But I'm trained classically, which is a big influence on me, I think.
author: Birdy

text: They wrapped her up like a baby burrito to show to Mom. Here were a mother and her daughter and I love them both so much. I couldn't wait for Courtney to come to the hospital so I could have all my women together.
author: Al Roker

text: People always accuse me of being motivational in a way, like it was a bad thing, but that's just how I was raised. My mom raised me in a positive environment, with lots of love in my heart, and that reflects in my music.
author: Lenny Kravitz

text: When I was going on auditions, it was nerve-racking. I'd always say to my mom that it would be awesome if I could get a series. When Modern Family came along, I said, 'You know what, Mom? I believe I'm going to get this role.'
author: Rico Rodriguez

text: My mother and my grandmother are pioneers of Mexican cuisine in this country, so I grew up in the kitchen. My mom, Zarela Martinez, was by far my biggest influence and inspiration - and toughest critic.
author: Aaron Sanchez

text: I was fortunate enough to have my kids early, so being a mom always ended up being a better gig than these other parts that came along. So I always justified not really working a lot because I had a family.
author: Heather Langenkamp

text: At first I could not believe what I was reading. I got up from my seat and walked away, talking to myself that I may have found my mom.
author: Reese Hoffa

text: My mom's passionate and energetic and very funny and enthusiastic.
author: Eric Stonestreet

text: I can't remember a time when my mom didn't work. She has forever been on the move: a go-getter. When my brother Adel and I had a paper route as kids, my mom would get up before us at the crack of dawn to drop off the Washington Post at different corners.
author: Hoda Kotb

text: Cancer has been unfortunately in my life. My mom's best friend is kicking ass in her battle with breast cancer. Both of my grandmas had cancer. I recently lost a friend to cancer.
author: Marla Sokoloff

text: For as long as I've been acting, I have been very lucky to be paired with really great actresses playing my mom.
author: Rico Rodriguez

text: For me, being tall was very positive because I thought my mom was the most beautiful person ever.
author: Lisa Leslie

text: My mom is very confident and she was always a role model of mine.
author: Ashley Tisdale

text: I had said to some pastor that I was having thoughts, and the church turned on me. They went to my mom and said, So sorry about your son.
author: Jai Rodriguez

text: Mom was a smoker. My grandfather was a smoker. My aunts were smokers. My uncles were smokers. I don't know any smokers now, not even my mom.
author: Jane Smiley

text: There are days when I wonder why my mom couldn't be here to see this.
author: Maya Rudolph

text: I was always a drama queen. I remember playing in the kitchen, trying to get my mom to think I was dead and call the police. When she didn't, I would cry. I was always theatrical. I don't think any of my relatives are surprised.
author: Amy Lee

text: My mom is great and I make sure that we pray together before every race. She helps me put everything in perspective and remind me of the real reason I run.
author: Allyson Felix

text: My mom and I had the same vision, and we want the same things. We would always make a goal list every year.
author: Kim Kardashian

text: My mom was a ventriloquist and she always was throwing her voice. For ten years I thought the dog was telling me to kill my father.
author: Wendy Liebman

text: My parents were both in show business. My father was an actor, my mom an actress, and both singers, dancers and actors. They met in Los Angeles doing a play together and so I grew up in a show biz family.
author: Micky Dolenz

text: I think I'm a really hands-on mom.
author: Brooke Burke

text: The fact that I'm very close with my past relationships is something I pride myself on. My mom is still close to her first husband. It's nice to be able to enjoy someone in a different form.
author: Kate Bosworth

text: Mothers are fonder than fathers of their children because they are more certain they are their own.
author: Aristotle

text: If I go on dates, my mom is always with me. She's always there making sure I'm all right. Like if I go to see a movie with a boy, she'll go to dinner next door.
author: Ariel Winter

text: If you would ask my mom what books I liked growing up, I liked Dr. Seuss.
author: will.i.am

text: Being a mom has made me so tired. And so happy.
author: Tina Fey

text: I'm a Mommy's Girl - the strongest influence in my young life was my mom.
author: Susie Bright

text: I think while all mothers deal with feelings of guilt, working mothers are plagued by guilt on steroids!
author: Arianna Huffington

text: I'm somebody who doesn't work with a stylist. I'll be honest with you, I'm a mom and it's just not something I want to put money toward because it's expensive to have somebody who helps dress you and I feel like I have to pay for preschool and so many things... so I don't have a stylist.
author: Busy Philipps

text: My mom calls me an older soul because, growing up, she taught me stuff real early. Now I spend most of my time chasing wisdom, chasing understanding.
author: Ray Lewis

text: It's quite hard to have your mom as a teacher - it's like, she's not necessarily a 'real teacher' for me. But she'd always teach me to really hear the music, and develop my ear, and to try and hear the harmonics of the piano.
author: Birdy

text: Miami Beach - that's where I grew up, in a middle-class Jewish family led by my maternal grandfather. Me, my great-grandmother - a Holocaust survivor, who was my roommate - my grandparents, my mom and her brother all shared a four-bedroom house.
author: Brett Ratner

text: My mom always said, 'Don't date a guy who thinks he's prettier than you.'
author: Alicia Keys

text: Mom worked with autistic children.
author: Isabel Lucas

text: People close to me called me 'Curry in a Hurry.' I was moving through life at 100 miles an hour trying to further my career and be a great mom and make everyone happy.
author: Ann Curry

text: A woman must combine the role of mother, wife and politician.
author: Emma Bonino

text: My mom died when I was 8.
author: Lisa Guerrero

text: I was brought up by a single mom in a poor town in Arkansas and while some aspects of small-town life were really positive - like the fact that everyone there is really sweet and hospitable - there is also this close-minded mentality, and that naturally made me want to rebel.
author: Beth Ditto

text: I never liked apples. In fact, when I was a little girl, my mom wanted to give me apples in my lunch box and I would ask for green peppers. So bizarre... It's funny - I don't have an apple a day, but I can say that I have a few a week.
author: Lana Parrilla

text: I wanted to get us a place of our own with a little bit more space. The kitchen is just huge, because my mom... lives there, man, and she loves being in the kitchen.
author: Freddy Adu

text: Being a working mom is not easy. You have to be willing to screw up at every level.
author: Jami Gertz

text: I was a big fan of 'The Smurfs' growing up, even though by default - my mom used to force me to watch because she was a 'Smurfs' fan.
author: Jayma Mays

text: My mother thinks I could have even run a larger company.
author: Christie Hefner

text: Every time I think I have something under control, it changes and I don't have it under control. I think it takes several years to get there. Jade is 19 months old, so right now I'm on alert all the time. And as a mom I think you're constantly worrying about things.
author: Giada De Laurentiis

text: My earliest acting memory is making up a play for my mom and dad called The Lonesome Baby. I have no idea what The Lonesome Baby was about. I just remember the title. But I'm sure it was an epic.
author: Jane Horrocks

text: Motherhood is the strangest thing, it can be like being one's own Trojan horse.
author: Rebecca West

text: My mom played the recorder. But not having electricity, we had minimal exposure to music. As I got a little older, we had Walkmans and things that were battery-powered, but it would have been nice to be growing up in the iPod era. A tape only has six songs on a side.
author: Bode Miller

text: I think my mom put it best. She said, 'Little girls soften their daddy's hearts.'
author: Paul Walker

text: In third grade, I was taking tap-dance lessons, and about six weeks before the recital I wanted to quit. My mom said, 'No, you're going to stay with it.' Well, I did it, and I was bad, too! But my parents never let their kids walk away from something because it was too hard.
author: Rebecca Lobo

text: My mom always said that if the Protestants catch a Catholic in their church, they feed them to the Jews.
author: Kate O'Brien

text: Never play cards with a man called Doc. Never eat at a place called Mom's. Never sleep with a woman whose troubles are worse than your own.
author: Nelson Algren

text: The best situation is being a single parent. The best part about is that you get time off, too, because the kids are with their mom, so it's the best of both worlds. There's a lot to be said for it.
author: Larry David

text: Growing up I always shopped at Victoria's Secret with my mom and saw Angels like Gisele and Karolina Kurkova in the windows.
author: Lindsay Ellingson

text: I like to write and draw and paint, and my mom's an artist, so I think I get caught up in thinking, 'I'm afraid it's gonna be bad,' and it's hard for me to start sometimes.
author: Kristen Wiig

text: And to this day, my Mom is my role model.
author: Paul Ryan

text: I remember, my mom didn't have any help, so if she needed to be somewhere after school, we'd just go down to the neighbors' and she'd give us a snack and make sure we did our homework. There weren't any latchkey kids.
author: Jennifer Garner

text: Depending on what day of the week it is and what time of the month it is, I'm a good friend or not a good friend. I'm more or less a good mom or not a good mom, more or less a good mate or not a good mate. That's just life, whether or not you're public.
author: Amy Grant

text: When I was 5, some financial things happened, and I moved seven times in a year. We moved from apartment to apartment, sometimes living with friends. My mom would always say, 'Don't get comfortable, because we may not be here long.'
author: LeBron James

text: When motherhood becomes the fruit of a deep yearning, not the result of ignorance or accident, its children will become the foundation of a new race.
author: Margaret Sanger

text: My very sassy, older southern sister is very quick to point out that it's a luxury that my daughter gets to come to work with me. She does, and I have lunch with her every single day. My mom says I have 'high class problems.'
author: Angela Kinsey

text: I'm like any working mom.
author: Kelly Ripa

text: My mom was always pretty supportive. She saw me do plays and she'd always act out the parts I did. My aunt, who played a big part in my life, was a little bit more reserved, because if they don't see you on TV every week they think you must be starving.
author: Angela Bassett

text: I never thought I was a great mom. I always worked. I fell in love with my children as they got older.
author: Marla Gibbs

text: My mom is painfully sweet she's from Nebraska.
author: Gabrielle Union

text: My mom is in the navy and my dad works for the army, but I never called them 'sir' or 'ma'am' or anything like that, and we never really moved around a lot because both my parents were stationed in D.C.
author: Ian Harding

text: When I see my mom in the stands, it always pushes me to succeed.
author: Ashton Eaton

text: When I was really young, my mom enrolled me in dance classes.
author: Jeff Bridges

text: My parents are wonderful, and I'm really lucky - but my mom has always been almost exclusively a right-brained person. She goes completely on her feelings of things, on her intuition, and so she instilled that in my brothers and I.
author: Brandon Boyd

text: When you are getting ready to become a mom, being in love with someone just isn't enough. You need to think about whether he would be a good parent and raise your children with similar beliefs.
author: Cindy Crawford

text: We've got activists all across the country like the members of the Million Mom March organization, some of their leaders are here tonight. We're phone banking congressional offices and pursuing editorial boards.
author: Michael D. Barnes

text: My mom's a secret Rastafarian.
author: Jenna Bush

text: My mom was an actress in the local Seattle theater doing experimental plays.
author: Rainn Wilson

text: My Mom is a ballet director, so I had this idea in me that classical training is the best foundation for anything you do, so I wanted to get a classical background and voice.
author: Shuler Hensley

text: When you're adopted, no matter what, you've got issues with unconditional love. And you find out you're the product of the worst situation for a young girl to be in and start her life, and I'm so grateful that my birth mom made the decision she made. She came from a rough situation.
author: Rodney Atkins

text: My mom is not trying to live vicariously through me.
author: Victoria Justice

text: I always think about which blood drive was going on in Georgia that day when that husband or mom or school teacher rolled up their sleeve and actually gave me a second chance at life. It's the ultimate gift of life, and I'm the one who was on the other end.
author: Niki Taylor

text: My mom told me to do whatever I wanted to do and don't get too anxious about it.
author: David Giuntoli

text: My mom had started to go to work when I was nine or ten, so I was aware of women trying to find their own identities by working. But I was still influenced by men to such an extreme. I wanted to play their games and wanted to compete in their world and be like them.
author: Elisabeth Shue

text: When I came out of my mom's womb, I had 'sitcom' stamped on my forehead.
author: Sean Hayes

text: Sometimes, if you don't have kids yourself, it's assumed you won't understand or know how to play a mom, which is kind of silly if you think about it.
author: Tricia Helfer

text: I care so passionately about improving the quality of life for women and girls, not just here in the United States, but internationally as well. I am a single mom and I raised a daughter who is now a young adult.
author: Valerie Jarrett

text: I want to be a fun mom. Not a gasping for air mom.
author: Mariska Hargitay

text: My mother said to me, 'If you are a soldier, you will become a general. If you are a monk, you will become the Pope.' Instead, I was a painter, and became Picasso.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: I auditioned on my own. I tried to make a mark for myself without anybody's help, not even Mom's.
author: Kate Hudson

text: I didn't really know what I wanted to do, and then I got this call from a casting director in Los Angeles. She remembered me from something years before, and she called my mom wanting me to audition for this thing.
author: Scott Speedman

text: I've never had my brows done - I tweeze them myself. I used to watch my mom pluck her brows, that's how I learned.
author: Emmy Rossum

text: My mom put me and my sisters in the water to feel comfortable, to have water safety.
author: Michael Phelps

text: My mom didn't let me play video games growing up, so now I do. Gaming gives me a chance to just let go, blow somebody up and fight somebody from another dimension. It's all escapism.
author: Wayne Brady

text: My mom was always the supplier of soccer balls, and so people were always knocking on my door, and trying to get me out so we could play.
author: Freddy Adu

text: When I was growing up in New Jersey, my mom would regularly take my sister and I into the city to see shows. I have many fond memories of standing in the half-price ticket line in Times Square and going to matinees.
author: Trey Anastasio

text: I think of myself as a fairly attractive girl and always have, thanks to my mom. I was brought into this world thinking I was gorgeous because my mother was extremely devoted to this notion.
author: Amy Schumer

text: My mom's one of 13 siblings, and they all got six kids, and till I was 13 everybody was in Compton.
author: Kendrick Lamar

text: I just go about my life. I'm a mom, I drive an SUV, I go to the grocery store every day. I'm definitely not a celebrity. I always say that I'm a celebrity-adjacent.
author: Diablo Cody

text: Before you're a mom you don't know what gear is going to be relevant.
author: Emily Procter

text: I could get away with not taking care of myself as a bachelorette but as a mom I can't.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: We were poor. But my mom never accepted that. She worked hard to become a residential contractor - got her master's with honors at the University of New Orleans. I used to go to every class with her. Her father was my paternal figure.
author: Frank Ocean

text: I really want to adopt a child... I want to be called 'Mom.' It really is the most beautiful word in the English language.
author: Patti Stanger

text: That strong mother doesn't tell her cub, Son, stay weak so the wolves can get you. She says, Toughen up, this is reality we are living in.
author: Lauryn Hill

text: I could never have pictured myself writing a book when I was 25 years old. My mom was an English teacher but I wasn't that way growing up.
author: Tony Dungy

text: Mom ran the house, so we grew up Portuguese.
author: Emeril Lagasse

text: My mom was such a strong character. I don't want to say she was like a man, but she was tough.
author: Lance Armstrong

text: My mom took me to a Dolly Parton concert when I was 3.
author: Kat Dennings

text: I'm a mom, a full-time mom when I'm not taping. I do the carpool thing, and bake the cookies, and do the homework.
author: Vanna White

text: There are lots of different ways for women to be a mom in this culture.
author: Kate Walsh

text: I know this is kind of corny, but we thought about renewing our vows again because I think my mom would really love it if we did that in Arkansas, where I came from.
author: Mary Steenburgen

text: My mom and my stepdad are both therapists.
author: Jennifer Westfeldt

text: My mom used to say that I became a fighter and a scrapper and a tough guy to protect who I am at my core.
author: Vin Diesel

text: I think it's a tough road if you're a stay-at-home mom, a working mom, if you have a partner, if you don't. It's the best job in the world, and the toughest job in the world all at the same time.
author: Angela Kinsey

text: When I got into junior high school, that's when my mom let me dress how I wanted to dress. Up to that point I wore suits to school all the time.
author: will.i.am

text: The man in our society is the breadwinner the woman has enough to do as the homemaker, wife and mother.
author: Dorothy Fields

text: You know, I loved math. My mom was a math teacher.
author: Joan Cusack

text: When I turned 18, my mom, my nana and I all went and had tattoos of our favorite Bible verses put on the inside of our wrists. Mine is 1st Timothy, 4:12.
author: Jordin Sparks

text: I always wanted to be a mom.
author: Heidi Klum

text: As far as I'm concerned, there's no job more important on the planet than being a mom.
author: Mark Wahlberg

text: I spend as much time with my kids as any mom who stays home. I only work during the hours they're at school, but there is always the sense of trying to catch up with all their stuff and not only organize my work life but also their school lives.
author: Patricia Heaton

text: When you think of couponing, you picture a mom cutting coupons out of the back of the newspaper.
author: Andrew Mason

text: My mom put me in a Pampers commercial on TV.
author: Christian Slater

text: My mom drives me crazy sometimes, but I have a good relationship with her.
author: Seth Rogen

text: My mom, Emilie, always taught me to think hard about marriage.
author: Alyson Hannigan

text: Mothers always find ways to fit in the work - but then when you're working, you feel that you should be spending time with your children and then when you're with your children, you're thinking about working.
author: Alice Hoffman

text: I'm a mom first, a singer second.
author: Gretchen Wilson

text: I'm not a businessperson. I have no sense of money. My mom does everything for me. She makes all my decisions for me, and even buys my clothes. She's very protective.
author: Coco Lee

text: They see me as being this Super Mom on TV who also can more than handle a difficult husband, and they assume I'm going to be just full of wisdom as a mother and wife myself.
author: Patricia Richardson

text: Then you've got Georgetown, and I really just like everything about them. When I went down there with my mom, it really opened my eyes to what they were all about. I have to factor in what a school like that can do for me, even away from being a basketball player.
author: Nerlens Noel

text: My daughter's name is Neesyn Dacey but everyone calls her Dacey. Her mom chose Neesyn and I chose Dacey after she was born. The mother is a good friend of mine who I was seeing a while ago. We are no longer together.
author: Bode Miller

text: I love playing moms. It's a lot easier than being a mom, I hear.
author: Faith Ford

text: We didn't have a TV in the living room and all my friends thought we were kind of weird. When they'd come over, my mom wanted to talk to them about current events.
author: Eliza Dushku

text: I've been drawing my whole life. My mom says my sister and I were drawing by age 1. Animation seems a real, natural extension of drawing as a way of telling a story visually.
author: Jennifer Yuh Nelson

text: I never Tweet about my daughter. Never. I just want to be respectful of her privacy. My job as a mom is to know when to open my mouth and when not to.
author: Padma Lakshmi

text: My mom taught us the Serenity Prayer at a young age.
author: Toby Keith

text: My mom is at my house every day, and she nags me about everything, especially hygiene.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: The Vatican is against surrogate mothers. Good thing they didn't have that rule when Jesus was born.
author: Elayne Boosler

text: I had so many offers after 'True Blood' for things that were someone in the same vein, but nowhere near Alan Ball's vision. Or something that was over-the-top and fantastical. And I've always wanted to play the regular, working-class mom, and I've never really had the chance to do that.
author: Michelle Forbes

text: My mom's hot. I mean she's old, but my mom's out of control.
author: Paul Walker

text: I'm not a figurehead for anything. I was a single mom with two kids. What else was I going to do? It was either be in a band or be a waitress.
author: Chrissie Hynde

text: My mom is in her mid-60s and has more energy and is more youthful than any human being I know. It's pretty incredible.
author: Oliver Hudson

text: My mom passed away a day before high school started, and her dream was for me to be a full rock and roll guy, and play drums in a band.
author: Travis Barker

text: She had a hit for every syllable: 'Don't. You. Ever. Talk. To. Me. Like. That. Ever. Again.' That was the last time I ever talked back to Mom.
author: Misty May-Treanor

text: I grew up in Marcy Projects in Brooklyn, and my mom and pop had an extensive record collection, so Michael Jackson and Stevie Wonder and all of those sounds and souls of Motown filled the house.
author: Jay-Z

text: The problem with me is, anything that's easy I will just overdo it. Especially with clothes. But I'm 14 - my mom is super-strict about that.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: My mom died of cancer when I was really young. I'm not someone who tries to work out their own stuff with a role, but I think that happened despite my best efforts to keep myself separate from it.
author: Sarah Polley

text: When I was a child, I wanted to be an actor, but I had really bad buckteeth. I didn't want to get braces, but my mom said I couldn't be an actor if I didn't get the braces. So, I got the braces.
author: James Franco

text: I want to make my music and be a happy woman, a good wife, a good mom and one day hopefully have a child of my own.
author: LeAnn Rimes

text: I didn't understand that I could sing until I was like 11 or 12. My mom heard me singing around the house and she said, What are you doing? You really can sing! So then I started going to school and singing to the girls.
author: Chris Brown

text: When I was a new mom, I used to think that life was going to be balanced, and I strived for that. But life is crazy!
author: Brooke Burke

text: I became a mom at 37 and having a child has been an emancipation for me.
author: Tori Amos

text: Mom would kill me if I showed my navel.
author: Brandy Norwood

text: Part of the reason that I moved to Los Angeles is that even though my mom introduced me to all kinds of music, I really wanted to work on having my own identify, on being who I am and doing what I do, and seeing how people responded.
author: Schuyler Fisk

text: My mom, God rest her soul - she liked nicknames. In the womb she named me Skip. There was another black guy in Piedmont, W.Va., and his name was Skip. They called him Big Skip, and I was Little Skip.
author: Henry Louis Gates

text: But my mom was a pianist, and she taught piano out of her house. I was just so excited, being a little kid and having all these other kids come to my house twice a week. I thought it was a big party.
author: Vanessa Carlton

text: I love what I do and I think it shows. As my kids get older, they can see me as a mom who loves working.
author: Jessica Capshaw

text: My mom is a very warm, typical sort of Jewish-mother type. And my dad has a somewhat, um, different personality.
author: Peter Orszag

text: I've changed my life in a lot of ways. I'm a mom, a wife, and a Christian. Some of the things I expressed in my early 20s aren't what I care to express right now.
author: Cheryl James

text: My goal is to be a household name, and when I do that, I want to help other girls become models, and maybe even launch a fashion line with my mom, like Beyonce did with her mother. My mom has such a good eye, and it's always been a dream of hers.
author: Chanel Iman

text: I feel like a good mom. I'm a strong woman now... Don't look down on me. Pray for me because I'm trying.
author: Fantasia Barrino

text: Whether it's a 16-year old girl, or a mom, or a guy, or anybody, as long as they come up and they're excited to meet me 'cause they've had some sort of relationship with something I've created, it's the coolest thing ever. It never gets old. It's awesome.
author: Andy Grammer

text: I was always at peace because of the way my mom treated me.
author: Martina Hingis

text: Because of my unique experience as my mom's child, the beginning of my journey was more about me trying to figure out who I was on my own. My mom is one of the greatest moms and so supportive of all my siblings and of all of us being who we are, and not who she wanted us to be.
author: Tracee Ellis Ross

text: Mother is far too clever to understand anything she does not like.
author: Arnold Bennett

text: My mom's the one I look up to for everything. I feel like I'm a lump of clay and she's moulding me into a woman.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: I want to be more successful as a mother than I am in show business.
author: Celine Dion

text: I'm a religious person. I remember my mom told me: 'Vengeance belongs to God. It's up to him to wreak vengeance.' It's hard for me to get to that point, but that's the work of God.
author: Rodney King

text: My mom raised us three boys by herself on welfare. It's not worse than anybody else's life.
author: Jeffrey Donovan

text: When I moved out of my mom's house at 18 I was almost as sad to leave her sewing machine behind as anything else.
author: Beth Ditto

text: Mommy smoked but she didn't want us to. She saw smoke coming out of the barn one time, so we got whipped.
author: Loretta Lynn

text: On my mom's side I'm Mexican, and my dad is a white dude.
author: Tyler Posey

text: You know that I am living proof that the American Dream is real. Growing up, our congressman cut through government bureaucratic red tape to help my mom buy our first house. That's the kind of congressman I'll be.
author: Geoff Davis

text: Our songs touch people, and take them back to a time when there was no threat of terrorism, when you didn't have to lock your doors and when Mom and Dad took care of everything.
author: George Grove

text: Washington has got to, across the board, lower taxes for small businesses so that our mom and pops can reinvest and hire people, so that our businesses can thrive.
author: Sarah Palin

text: When you're a mom and you have three children, nothing bothers you. Trust me. Who cares what people say? I've got other things to deal with.
author: Faith Hill

text: My sisters and my mom, those people help me get through every single day.
author: Demi Lovato

text: When I was 15, I worked at a dry cleaner because I wanted Abercrombie & Fitch jeans. My mom told me I could have $20 jeans, not $70 jeans, unless I was willing to work for them. So I did!
author: Ashley Greene

text: I've always been a writer because I've always been a student. My mom's a retired professor, so I come from a very academic background. I love writing, you know?
author: Kerry Washington

text: I couldn't wait until I grew up. I used to look at my mom's stockings and put them on with her high heels and mess with my hair.
author: Florence Griffith Joyner

text: I remember my mom dressed like Janis Joplin.
author: Bryan White

text: Growing up, my ideals were Barbra Streisand, Cher, and my mom.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: Well, my mom taught public school music for almost 40 years. And she's about 5 feet - and very mighty. And she would control her kids a lot by giving them the eye, or the stare.
author: Vanessa Williams

text: Sinatra was just one of Mom's friends.
author: Lorna Luft

text: I've learned that every working mom is a superwoman.
author: Uma Thurman

text: My mom was a Democrat and I was scared to death that she was gonna blow it. First I was going to hell with Monroe, and now to Republican hell with Nixon.
author: Tommy Rettig

text: Some of the best times I've spent in Colorado have been in the backcountry with my mom and siblings, and more recently, with my own kids. That is why I'm concerned to see today's kids spending more time browsing the Internet than exploring nature.
author: Mark Udall

text: When I was young, I had two older sisters, and since I was the youngest in my family, my mom took me around with her all the time. I was forever with her when she was having coffee in the middle of the afternoon with her three sisters. And they would talk about men. I absorbed a lot of that.
author: Richard LaGravenese

text: My hero is Michelle Williams, who I grew close to when we did 'Meek's Cutoff.' She's an extraordinary actor and mom.
author: Zoe Kazan

text: I was born to a Nigerian dad and a Kenyan mom, and coming to the States was really academic.
author: Dayo Okeniyi

text: My mom always made sure I lived my life as a regular kid.
author: Soleil Moon Frye

text: My mother worked in factories, worked as a domestic, worked in a restaurant, always had a second job.
author: Ed Bradley

text: It's the best thing ever - I love being a mom. This is my only child. My career was a priority earlier in my life, but now my son is definitely the priority.
author: Stephanie Mills

text: I'm so proud to represent the people of South Florida. I was so honored when President Obama asked me to serve as chair of the Democratic Party. But there's one job I'm even more proud of, and that's being a mom to my three kids, Rebecca, Jake and Shelby.
author: Debbie Wasserman Schultz

text: I was really lucky. My gal pal was my mom.
author: Ana Ortiz

text: With my new venture, Club Mom, we want to empower moms to feel their value and also build their collective power to make their lives better and easier. We want to bring them together as a community to share experiences and information.
author: Andrew Shue

text: For me, just being how old I am, I know I don't want to be a single mom. I really would rather make it a two-person job. But I've also come to terms with not being a mother at all. I'm actually really good with either direction that my life can take as being a valid experience.
author: Lisa Edelstein

text: I like my name. My mom named me after a song by the 1970s group Bread. So, it's meaningful, and I like the song. It's a love song - kind of - but it's kind of depressing and dark.
author: Aubrey Plaza

text: I think the real heroic teachers are the ones who work with kids, like my mom and my sister do.
author: David Duchovny

text: Everyone in my family is an artist. Both my parents are painters and my mom's an opera singer. I was never shown any other way to process life.
author: Aleksa Palladino

text: So far I'm not surprised by anything about being a mom. It's all pretty great - but that's what I expected.
author: Charlize Theron

text: It was definitely a part of our life. I mean, my mom had both her brothers and her fiancee in Vietnam at the same time, so it wasn't just my dad's story, it was my mom's story too. And we definitely grew up listening to the stories.
author: Vanessa Kerry

text: I have to keep reminding myself that I am their mother. Sometimes we are sitting at home and I feel like we are waiting for our mom to come home.
author: Ruby Wax

text: My mom taught me not to talk about money.
author: Hilary Duff

text: There is nothing like becoming a mom to fill you with fear.
author: Arianna Huffington

text: My dad was Jewish. My mom is not. So I was not raised anything.
author: Matt Lauer

text: My mom lived by herself with two kids. Sacrifice was the name of the game at our house.
author: Victor Cruz

text: My mom has a tape from when I was, like, 2 years old, talking with my grandma, telling her a story that's really elaborate about werewolves and wolves.
author: Amanda Hocking

text: When you're sick, nobody takes care of you like your mom.
author: Trisha Yearwood

text: My mom's never been married. I've never even seen my mom kiss a dude.
author: will.i.am

text: My mom and dad put my brother and sister through university and they were very keen for us to have an academic background just to give us a chance.
author: Rob James-Collier

text: I'm a mom - I'm lucky if I get to shower in the morning. Luckily, nail polish stays on my toes. I've been so bad on the upkeep, though.
author: Idina Menzel

text: I wanted to escape so badly. But of course I knew I couldn't just give up and leave school. It was only when I heard my mom's voice that I came out of my hiding place.
author: Zhang Ziyi

text: I don't think I would have been able to stick with it and been proud of who I am and be feminine out on the court. I think I would have folded to the peer pressure if I didn't have my mom to encourage me to be me and be proud of how tall I am.
author: Lisa Leslie

text: My mom taught me how to make grilled chicken, and I bake, too.
author: Rico Rodriguez

text: I'm a mom, so I have to be comfortable. Jeans are a staple - I have way too many in my closet! It's warm in Florida, so I wear jeans and a tank top every day. I love my True Religions, my Rich and Skinny, and Citizens of Humanity. But I also love getting dressed up!
author: Candace Cameron Bure

text: I begged my mom to let me start skating.
author: Debi Thomas

text: We didn't have movies in this little mining town. When I was 12 my mom took me to New York and I saw Bye Bye Birdie, with people singing and dancing, and that was it.
author: Margot Kidder

text: One of my most sentimental items is my grandmother's engagement ring that my mom gave me a few years ago. It's a Victorian-style setting that's closed in the back, so it doesn't sparkle the way diamonds do now. I wear it as a pendant.
author: Georgina Chapman

text: I have many valentines. My mom and my sister and my directors. I got calls from all of them. And my friends. I respect what Valentine's Day stands for because it is about love.
author: Michelle Trachtenberg

text: My mom had me when she was 16, and I was an only child, which is probably why I received a lot of love and didn't miss that my father wasn't around.
author: Brett Ratner

text: There are days when I struggle with wanting to be a full-time, stay-at-home mom, and feeling guilty about that because I work.
author: Tori Spelling

text: I'm almost a full-time mom.
author: Ekaterina Gordeeva

text: My mom really instilled in me that I'm beautiful and I can do anything, and I echo that now with my own girls.
author: Jennie Garth

text: A Modern Mom to me is not always someone that juggles a career and family. A Modern Mom is a woman who takes care of herself on the inside and the outside.
author: Regina King

text: Once in high school, I completely over plucked my left eyebrow all the way up to where you're not supposed to. I had no idea what I was doing and it looked terrible! My mom was like 'What did you do to yourself?' I was so embarrassed.
author: Ashley Tisdale

text: I was born to a single mom and raised by her and my grandparents.
author: Anthony Foxx

text: Just recently I was in Target with my mom shopping, and out of the blue, I see this father and his two daughters and he says, 'Can they get a picture with you?' And I'm thinking to myself, 'Am I the one millionth customer or something?'
author: Atticus Shaffer

text: I would borrow my mom's red Borghese lipstick and smear it on like a clown!
author: Brooke Burns

text: Of all the roles I've played, none has been as fulfilling as being a mother.
author: Annette Funicello

text: I'm a just a mom when I walk down the street.
author: Alice Barrett

text: The relationship between Cathy and Mom in the strip is the one relationship drawn from real life that I have proudly never even tried to disguise.
author: Cathy Guisewite

text: Mom thinks I live in this dream world where everybody's Ivana Trump.
author: Kathie Lee Gifford

text: My mom is definitely my rock.
author: Alicia Keys

text: I think there's a danger of a being typecast as the all-American mom forever.
author: JoBeth Williams

text: What does good in bed mean to me? When I'm sick and I stay home from school propped up with lots of pillows watching TV and my mom brings me soup - that's good in bed.
author: Brooke Shields

text: My mother stopped working when she had my brother. She was a full time mom until I started getting heavily into ice skating lessons, and it got to the point where they really needed my mom to earn an income.
author: Dorothy Hamill

text: My mother told me on several different occasions that she was livin' her dream vicariously through me. She once said that I was getting' to do all the things that she would have wanted to have done.
author: Buck Owens

text: Country was about character. Country's changed because of monsters like Clear Channel who bought up all the stations and sliced them up into formats. Our demographic is now the soccer mom.
author: Gary Allan

text: I made some truly awful movies. 'Stop! Or My Mom Will Shoot' was the worst. If you ever want someone to confess to murder just make him or her sit through that film. They will confess to anything after 15 minutes.
author: Sylvester Stallone

text: When I get a new script my mom will read them and just be aghast. I think it's hysterical.
author: Alia Shawkat

text: The one thing my mom will let me get is a nice shoe sometimes.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: My mom was a teacher - I have the greatest respect for the profession - we need great teachers - not poor or mediocre ones.
author: Condoleezza Rice

text: I may be the only mother in America who knows exactly what their child is up to all the time.
author: Barbara Bush

text: Mom and Pop were proud of my popularity, but from their point of view, show business was no way to make a living.
author: Ethel Merman

text: Losing my mom at such a young age had a profound effect on my life.
author: Molly Shannon

text: I just got my phone back yesterday. My mom had it for two days. I was supposed to read a book and I really wanted to play Call Of Duty.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: My mom was the picture of the blue-collar mom: Two and three and four jobs to make sure that me and my sister never needed, that was her thing.
author: Ne-Yo

text: Two weeks ago at the U.S. Amateur, my mom caddied, and that is kind of a different feeling, because she's your mom and you have to listen to her. It was really comfortable having my mom there, but it's also really relieving and comfortable to have someone that knows the course off their hat, really.
author: Lydia Ko

text: I grew up with the classics. My mom and I would sit and watch 'Singin' in the Rain' and 'White Christmas' - those kind of movies.
author: Lucas Grabeel

text: I probably wouldn't be singing if not for Michael Jackson. When I started singing, I didn't like my tone until my mom put me on to Michael Jackson and Stevie Wonder, so listening to the way they used their instrument helped me get more comfortable with my own.
author: Ne-Yo

text: My mom bought me a white Strat, but that wasn't what I wanted, so I went to a guitar store in Cleveland and - the guy told me it was a really good deal - made an even swap for a blue Teisco Del Ray. I loved that guitar and used it a bunch.
author: Dan Auerbach

text: My mom loved rock 'n roll. My father hated it. We couldn't play it when he was around.
author: Patti Smith

text: When I can 10 or 11, my mom was the one out there catching passes for me. She was my prime receiver.
author: Joe Theismann

text: If you just stay away from junk, and stick with what your mom taught you, you're eating pretty healthy.
author: Sprague Grayden

text: I shoplifted. I was about five years old, and I took a candy from a store. We paid for three of them, but I took four, and I went home and cried. My mom took me back, and I paid for the missing piece.
author: Carrie-Anne Moss

text: Oh, my mom. She's one of my biggest fans.
author: Patina Miller

text: I have a chaperone everywhere I go - my mom.
author: Shawn Johnson

text: I had ridiculous amounts of energy. Mom's like, you're driving me crazy - do you want to try gymnastics? From the moment I started it, I loved it and it kind of was like storybook from there.
author: Alicia Sacramone

text: I told my agents that I didn't want to go on the audition. But as that was happening I called my mom, who has been watching the show from the beginning, and my mom said, 'It's the coolest show. You have to go.'
author: Mary Lynn Rajskub

text: Being a mother is hard and it wasn't a subject I ever studied.
author: Ruby Wax

text: Motherhood is at its best when the tender chords of sympathy have been touched.
author: Paul Harris

text: I sing seriously to my mom on the phone. To put her to sleep, I have to sing 'Maria' from West Side Story. When I hear her snoring, I hang up.
author: Adam Sandler

text: Giving birth was easier than having a tattoo.
author: Nicole Appleton

text: I always say I am a realist, and my mom says, 'No, you just have anxiety.'
author: Jessica Chastain

text: My mom moved up between Leland and Greenville when I was just a little tot.
author: Little Milton

text: I love getting my nails done. My mom's best friend is a manicurist. When I was little, she'd do little paintings on my nails, like flowers.
author: Miranda Cosgrove

text: I naturally wanted to be saved, so when I came home I told my mom I wanted to be confirmed. That's the way I related to it, being raised an Episcopalian. I went to Dallas and got confirmed.
author: T-Bone Burnett

text: My mom would be leaving the house and she'd say, 'Don't you pull out all of the old dresses in the attic and put on a show again!' And the door would close, and that's exactly what I'd do. The show was calling me!
author: Michael Patrick King

text: It's her first grandchild, so she's really, really, really excited. I guess my mom is a little more stressed out than me.
author: Brandy Norwood

text: I'm a better mother if I'm also doing my work. Some women find a lot more satisfaction from doing the hardest job, which is being a mom. But I like my day job, so I juggle a lot.
author: Katey Sagal

text: I'm a mom first.
author: Mindy McCready

text: Well, you know, I was raised by a 1970s feminist. My mom had a consciousness-raising group. I used to sit at the top of the stairs and listen to them.
author: Ayelet Waldman

text: God blessed me with two unbelievable parents, and I am just like both of them. I have the smile and charisma of my mother and the big heart of my mom, because she wants to save the world and help the world, so I am just like her.
author: Magic Johnson

text: My brother Jim and I spent many wonderful summers working on dairy farms in Wisconsin owned by Mom's cousins, and as members of our local Boy Scout troop.
author: Peter Agre

text: My mom loved to sing - and I'll go on record and say she was the worst singer ever. I'd get up and move away from her!
author: Kenny Rogers

text: Well, Mom and Dad are both actors, and I've spent a lot of time watching my mom on stage and a lot of time on set with my dad, so it was very much a part of my growing up.
author: Eleanor Tomlinson

text: Sunscreen is my number 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 tip. I'm a fanatic, partially because I live in L.A. and have fair skin and freckles, and partially because of my kids. My mom always made me wear sunscreen and I'm trying to be that mom for them.
author: Alison Sweeney

text: Don't let people disrespect you. My mom says don't open the door to the devil. Surround yourself with positive people.
author: Cuba Gooding, Jr.

text: I grew up with just my mom. She and I were like best friends. She's a very independent woman and I admire that about her. In my life, I've tried to be like that. To be okay with being on my own and being independent.
author: Emma Roberts

text: When I look up and see a star, I know my mom is there. She's with me all the time. It's a powerful connection.
author: Emmanuelle Chriqui

text: My mom never taught me to be waiting for some prince on a white horse to swipe me off my feet.
author: Tyra Banks

text: My mom always encouraged me, it was never weird. She'd look at 'Heavy Metal' and go 'Woo-hoo!'
author: Zack Snyder

text: My mom would have liked it that I patterned myself more after Jimmy Reed.
author: Jimmy Smith

text: You don't realize how hard it is to live on your own. But there's no mom to do your laundry, and make you dinner and to do things for you, and you don't think about little things like buying paper towels and salt.
author: Emma Roberts

text: I wanted to be a 150% entrepreneur and a 150% mom, and I found that I was having a very hard time doing both. I was about 75% and 75% - still better than 100%, but not what I was accustomed to at work.
author: Barbara Corcoran

text: Now that I'm a mom, I'm way more laid back. If you come into my house, don't look for a coaster. Forget it. There is not a piece of furniture in my house now that is too precious.
author: Angela Kinsey

text: My first big job was an Abercrombie &ampFitch campaign. But my mom wouldn't let me skip school for it, so I missed half of the shoot. When we got there, we realized Bruce Weber was the photographer we knew we had made a mistake!
author: Lauren Bush

text: My mom always says I cut my teeth on the church pew.
author: Miranda Lambert

text: When I was a kid and got in trouble, I'd always say, Mom, I'm in trouble. Well, Mom, I'm in trouble.
author: Earl Campbell

text: I know my mom said as early as she can remember letting me watch TV, my one treat a week when I was like 6 was to stay up and watch 'Saturday Night Live.'
author: Rashida Jones

text: I remember my mom saying to me that what your friends do is one thing, but what you do could be on the front page of the paper.
author: Scott McClellan

text: Take motherhood: nobody ever thought of putting it on a moral pedestal until some brash feminists pointed out, about a century ago, that the pay is lousy and the career ladder nonexistent.
author: Barbara Ehrenreich

text: My mom and father are extremely proud. They love it when I don't die. I've done so many movies where I've died that their first question when I book a job is, 'So, are you going to die in this?'
author: Michael Ealy

text: Something my mom taught me when I was little is that everything happens for a reason.
author: Shawn Johnson

text: How simple a thing it seems to me that to know ourselves as we are, we must know our mothers names.
author: Alice Walker

text: I was a brownie for a day. My mom made me stop. She didn't want me to conform.
author: Sandra Bullock

text: I think I'd be a great mom, honestly. I don't think I'll have any problem giving them all the love in the world. Discipline will be the hard part.
author: Queen Latifah

text: Sure, my childhood was unusual. All these eccentric, wild people frequented our home: rock stars, drag queens, models, bikers, freaks. But I was not this little rich girl. My mom and I lived in an apartment.
author: Liv Tyler

text: My mom cooked pot roast with noodles and frozen vegetables. Or she'd make spaghetti or hot dogs, or heat up TV dinners. Before I started modeling at age 19, I was 5'8" and weighed 165 pounds.
author: Carol Alt

text: I was raised in Boston by three older brothers and a very strong and empowering single mom.
author: Eliza Dushku

text: I wanted to be an astronaut and wanted to go to space camp, but then I found out that I was too short to become an astronaut. My mom really made me believe that if I worked hard enough and if I really wanted to do it, I could do it.
author: Soleil Moon Frye

text: I love kids and children, and I love being a mom.
author: Jennie Garth

text: My mom died when I was 16. I had a rough childhood, you know what I mean, but it made me strong.
author: Travis Barker

text: I always had an interest in fashion because my mom is a celebrity fashion stylist. I grew up being on set or in showrooms.
author: Jasmine Tookes

text: I'm a nice, happily married wife and mom and I live in Connecticut.
author: Christine Baranski

text: I'm from Tennessee. My mom lives in Nashville. I'm born and bred country. That's all I listen to.
author: Lucy Hale

text: The 'believe' tattoo is because my mom always told me to believe.
author: Ashley Tisdale

text: I always was drawn to the performing arts. I started dancing when I was two. I sang, loved to act, and loved going to visit my mom on-set. But she wanted me to have a normal childhood, so I wasn't really allowed to pursue acting till I got older.
author: Rainey Qualley

text: For some students, school is the only place where they get a hot meal and a warm hug. Teachers are sometimes the only ones who tell our children they can go from an Indian reservation to the Ivy League, from the home of a struggling single mom to the White House.
author: Denise Juneau

text: The woman is uniformly sacrificed to the wife and mother.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

text: I burnt myself out of skating. I was ready to focus on being a mom.
author: Kristi Yamaguchi

text: My mom, Irmelin, taught me the value of life. Her own life was saved by my grandmother during World War II.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

text: I want somebody like my mom. My mom is a very charitable woman. She's the sweetest woman in the world. I'm looking for the second sweetest woman in the world. I'm looking for honesty and a big heart.
author: Jason Derulo

text: When I was 11 my friend's mom made a peanut butter sandwich. I ate the sandwich and was like, 'I'm never eating anything else again.' And I still eat peanut butter every day. I would put peanut butter on a steak.
author: Aasif Mandvi

text: My mom didn't use face cream, like, nothing at all. She's got great skin and looks very youthful.
author: Lara Stone

text: Ever since I was a little kid, I've felt comfortable in a suit. It all started when my mom bought me a three-piece Pierre Cardin suit. I wore that thing everywhere. Eventually I realized I was going to be the kid who got beat up in school, but I kept wearing it.
author: Paul Feig

text: I just started watching wrestling in 2008, and I've loved it ever since. I told my mom I wanted to become a wrestler.
author: Rico Rodriguez

text: I used to do skits for my mom... and I was always entertaining as a kid.
author: Leah Remini

text: Financial hardships were rough on us, even though Mom had a good job at G.M.
author: Ryan White

text: Once you're a mom, always a mom. It's like riding a bike, you never forget.
author: Taraji P. Henson

text: What is free time? I'm a single mother. My free moments are filled with loving my little girl.
author: Roma Downey

text: My mom used to have a lot of European cinema playing in the house, so I'd catch bits and pieces of films.
author: Mia Wasikowska

text: I heard the Beatles and the Stones, and Mom bought me an electric guitar. I played lead for four years and then switched to bass. One day someone suggested that I should sing, so I sheepishly stepped up to the microphone and the rest is rock history.
author: Glenn Hughes

text: I'm ridiculous in my oversharing my mom and sister are very open but a little more judicious than me... and my father is a decidedly private person.
author: Lena Dunham

text: Being the only man in the household with my mom definitely helped me grow up fast.
author: LeBron James

text: I was worried about my mom more than I was worried about the president. And then I was worried about the president, and then I was worried about myself.
author: Monica Lewinsky

text: My parents, especially my mother, were no influence on me whatsoever.
author: Andy Partridge

text: I had always loved to write and my mom was my editor for my school papers.
author: Jenna Bush

text: I always knew I wanted kids, but when my mom passed away I was like, 'I want a bunch of kids. I want three kids or four kids, and I want to have that relationship again.' I can't bring my mom back, but I can have children.
author: Mindy Kaling

text: That's a big deal for kids, when they come into the kitchen and the teacher is drinking coffee with mom. They react differently on the next day when you say: 'Sit down and shut-up!'
author: Ed O'Neill

text: So, from a very young age, my mom tells me that I wanted to be Michael J. Fox. I didn't want to be an actor. I just wanted to be Michael J. Fox for awhile. And then, I realized that he was an actor, so I pursued that.
author: Patrick J. Adams

text: The most important thing in my father's life? World peace. Me and my brother. My mom.
author: Sean Lennon

text: If my mom reads that I'm grammatically incorrect I'll have hell to pay.
author: Larisa Oleynik

text: I remember my mom had a big collection of copies of Saturday Evening Post magazines, and that was really my introduction to those great illustrators.
author: Thomas Kincade

text: I was almost 8 years old when I was watching a kid on a TV commercial, and I told my mom that I wanted to do the same thing. She said that I would need to get an agent and that she would research it.
author: Victoria Justice

text: My sisters and mom raised me to respect women and open doors for them.
author: Milo Ventimiglia

text: I remember my mom saying that after you have a baby you get really thin. So you gain all that weight and then you just lose it and keep losing it.
author: Arizona Muse

text: What motivated me? My mother. My mother was an immigrant woman, a peasant woman, struggled all her life, worked in the garment center.
author: Al Lewis

text: Even in high school, I'd tell my mom I was sick of swimming and wanted to try to play golf. She wasn't too happy. She'd say, 'Think about this.' And I'd always end up getting back in the pool.
author: Michael Phelps

text: Many of my books come from what if questions that I can't answer, things that I'm worried about as either a woman, a wife, a mom, an American.
author: Jodi Picoult

text: Everyone checks out my mom. My mom's hot.
author: Ashley Scott

text: My father left... but I tell my mom - and I told my mom this when I was a kid - I said, 'You know what, Mom? Good thing he left because you're a strong woman.'
author: J. R. Martinez

text: Our parents are obviously proud, but they're still trying to get used to the fact that we're in a band. I have a feeling my mom would actually like One Direction if I wasn't in it!
author: Zayn Malik

text: I'm not sure anyone - and I could be wrong in this - grows up thinking, I want to be a single mom.
author: Bridget Moynahan

text: I grew up in a family of Republicans. And when I was 18 and registering to vote, my mom's only instruction was 'You just go in and pull the big Republican lever.' That's my welcome to adulthood. She's like, 'No, don't even read it. Just pull the Republican lever.
author: Tina Fey

text: My mom, she is the most unbelievable mom that you could ever have in your entire life and she's always with me on everything. The most I've ever been away from her is two days. I love her more than anybody could ever know.
author: Dakota Fanning

text: Not that we didn't have close relationships with our parents - I'm very close to my mom - but parents didn't think anything of going off for a few weeks and leaving their kids.
author: Candice Bergen
