text: My mom once lost track of me at the zoo and when she found me I was lecturing a man about the difference between dromedary and Bactrian camels. I was about 3 1/2.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

text: I have a very close relationship with my mom, and I'm able to talk to her about anything.
author: Jessica Szohr

text: I'm an immigrant kid who came to America from India when I was very young and grew up in New York City with a single mom and really was influenced by all of those immigrant cultures bumping up against each other.
author: Padma Lakshmi

text: If I could get any animal it would be a dolphin. I want one so bad. Me and my mom went swimming with dolphins and I was like, 'How do we get one of those?' and she was like, 'You can't get a dolphin. What are you gonna do, like, put it in your pool?'
author: Miley Cyrus

text: I had really great parents who always gave me lots of opportunity for choice, but I didn't always realize how rare that was for a girl for them to say, 'You can be a mom or have a career or do both or do something we haven't thought of yet.'
author: Ally Condie

text: I know how to do anything, I'm a mom.
author: Roseanne Barr

text: I must admit, even though I'm the product of two Jewish parents, I think the Irish temper got in there somewhere, so I'm going to check Mom's genealogy.
author: Harvey Weinstein

text: I'm talking like 10, 12 years old. Either junior brings Mom and Pop or Mom and Pop bring the kids. I'm talking young here, not a college drinking crowd.
author: George Thorogood

text: My memory of my mom is a wine glass in one hand and a cigarette in the other. She was a runway fashion model, and she was quite a glamorous woman.
author: Loni Anderson

text: My mom won't let anyone treat me like a little princess.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: My mom put me in dance classes when I was 5 years old.
author: Danny Pudi

text: I was embarrassed that I even wanted to become an actress because coming from L.A., with two older sisters in the business and a mom who had been a ballet dancer, it was such a cliche.
author: Elizabeth Olsen

text: I was into opera as a kid - I'd play 'Carmen' and sing and dance. My mom signed me up for a theater group before preschool, and I never looked back.
author: Nina Arianda

text: In Hollywood, you play a mom and instantly, you've got osteoporosis.
author: Gabrielle Union

text: I've looked at pictures that my mom has of me, from when I was four years old at the turntable. I'm there, reaching up to play the records. I feel like I was bred to do what I do. I've been into music, and listening to music and critiquing it, my whole life.
author: Dr. Dre

text: I'm not blaming my mom for my life because I am responsible for me, and nobody can change me or ruin me easier than I can.
author: Mindy McCready

text: My mom knows when something is real and something is not.
author: Christina Ricci

text: I wasn't always a writer. When I went to college and majored in fine arts, I was a painter. Then I was a stay-at-home mom.
author: Janet Evanovich

text: The person who has inspired me my whole life is my Mom, because she taught me commitment. She sacrificed.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

text: Mom never quit on me. My only regret is that she didn't live long enough to share some of the money and comforts my work in show business has brought me.
author: Ethel Waters

text: I do believe that there are African Americans who have thick accents. My mom has a thick accent my relatives have thick accents. But sometimes you have to adjust when you go into the world of film, TV, theatre, in order to make it accessible to people.
author: Viola Davis

text: I want to be a loving mom.
author: Tori Spelling

text: I'm so happy and thankful I made it a point be a stay-at-home mom.
author: Candace Cameron Bure

text: I have a 16 year-old son, so I'm now a soccer mom. I stand on the sidelines and I hear the things parents are saying, so I want them to understand what it is their kids are feeling in any sports environment.
author: Brandi Chastain

text: I think because I became a mom later in life, everything in life means more.
author: Mariska Hargitay

text: I'm from Manchester, Mass., so it was lobster, lobster and more lobster! Also, lots of fish that we caught in the summers, clam chowder and roast beef sandwiches. But my mom was pretty healthy we had a lot of chicken and broccoli and rice as well.
author: Sprague Grayden

text: My mom has a good way of engaging me in a conversation about the choices I make, listening, being objective and open-minded, and respecting those choices so long as they don't put me in danger.
author: Casey Affleck

text: My mom always says, 'If you don't believe in something, you'll lose yourself completely.'
author: Hilary Duff

text: I'm extremely blessed to have the extraordinary mother that I have, and I don't mean Diana Ross, I mean the mother. My mom paved a road that didn't exist, as did Oprah.
author: Tracee Ellis Ross

text: My mom was at every single game I played as a kid, rain or shine.
author: Ryne Sandberg

text: I slept with my mom until I was 16 years old.
author: Jennifer Hudson

text: My mom was a model. She had me at 20, so she was a young mother.
author: Michael Kors

text: My mom, she's still always there for me. Always.
author: David Ortiz

text: My mom came from such humble beginnings and especially my dad as well. He didn't go to university.
author: Petra Ecclestone

text: Imagine my surprise when, after a lifetime of teaching me to keep personal things to myself, Mom insisted my drawings were the start of a comic strip for millions of people to enjoy.
author: Cathy Guisewite

text: I've had Susan Sarandon play my mom, and now Lesley Ann Warren has played my mom, so if I could have Debra Winger play my mom, then I would have the trifecta of my favorite actresses playing my mother.
author: Jenna Fischer

text: Now, if you're Al Gore, you can afford $10 a pop for squiggly-pig-tailed fluorescent light bulbs. But if you're mainstream America, two or three kids, mom and dad working outside the home, that's not a very good deal.
author: Joe Barton

text: My relationship with my mom is really the single most profound relationship that I've ever had in my life.
author: Mindy Kaling

text: My mom would put me in these preppy little suits and slick my hair to the side. I have these baby pictures of me where I'm this little preppy kid with a sweater tied around my neck.
author: Alexander Wang

text: I am truly my mother's son.
author: David Geffen

text: I hear my friends and my mom tell me I'm special, but honestly, I still don't get it.
author: LeBron James

text: My mom is this liberal, feminist, Mormon powerhouse. I just love her to death.
author: Eliza Dushku

text: My mom is a sculptress.
author: P. J. Harvey

text: Having a child makes you realize the importance of life - narcissism goes out the window. Heaven on earth is looking at my little boy. The minute he was born, I knew if I never did anything other than being a mom, I'd be fine.
author: Jenny McCarthy

text: My mother was a single mom, and most of the women I know are strong.
author: Regina King

text: Anyone who knows me knows my mom, Dorcina, has to sign off on any decision and that she will play a major part in any decision.
author: Nerlens Noel

text: When I was a kid, my mom used to run the vacuum cleaner, and the noise would bother me so much that I would run into the woods to calm down. I feel like that vacuum cleaner has been on since I moved to New York City.
author: Steve Burns

text: My mom was diagnosed with breast cancer when I was 13 and it was something we weren't really aware of as a family.
author: Rima Fakih

text: My parents are wonderful, and I'm really lucky - but my mom has always been almost exclusively a right-brained person.
author: Brandon Boyd

text: My mom gives me an allowance. She keeps me pretty tight-reined.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: My mom's discipline worked out perfectly. I wouldn't change a thing.
author: will.i.am

text: I think my mom threatened to put me up for adoption a few times.
author: Ivanka Trump

text: My mom is always telling me it takes a long time to get to the top, but a short time to get to the bottom.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: I guess I was a mom so late in life, my daughter was the greatest thing since sliced bread.
author: Candice Bergen

text: Throughout my life, my mom has been the person that I've always looked up to.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

text: My mother was predominately a stay-at-home mom.
author: Andrew Rannells

text: My mom would take me to restaurants, and the first thing I'd ask for would be a pen and a napkin, and I'd sketch shoes and shoes and shoes.
author: Alexander Wang

text: I've never had siblings, I didn't grow up in a big family it was just me and my single mom. And hectic family dysfunction was actually something that I craved.
author: Emmy Rossum

text: My mother gets all mad at me if I stay in a hotel. I'm 31-years-old, and I don't want to sleep on a sleeping bag down in the basement. It's humiliating.
author: Ben Affleck

text: I work too much to be an appropriate parent. I feel like a bad mom to my dog some days because I'm just not here enough. I just feel like I would do a bad job if I took the time to literally give birth to a kid right now and try and juggle everything I'm doing.
author: Rachael Ray

text: I feel like I'm a stay-at-home mom, which I was for the five years before this. She's absolutely been my focus. That's the choice I made. Desperate Housewives is perfect for me. I get to go back to work and still be able to take my daughter to school and pick her up.
author: Teri Hatcher

text: I look at my father. He is one of my heroes. He is such an incredible, classy man. He was such a great father and such a great husband in so many ways, and we lived through some pretty tough times losing my mom. When I see all that he did, I think, 'Wow, that's a really wonderful man.'
author: Emmanuelle Chriqui

text: I was a hyper kid in school and the teacher suggested to my mom she needed to do something with me.
author: Devon Sawa

text: I spend my afternoons painting and working on my Open Hearts jewelry line for Kay Jewelers. I designed an image of a heart that isn't completely closed. My mom always told me to live with an open heart - when life gets tough, you should go out and help someone else.
author: Jane Seymour

text: We need somebody who's got the heart, the empathy, to recognize what it's like to be a young teenage mom, the empathy to understand what it's like to be poor or African-American or gay or disabled or old - and that's the criterion by which I'll be selecting my judges.
author: Barack Obama

text: I'd go to, like, six different schools in one year. We were on welfare, and my mom never ever worked.
author: Eminem

text: If I could be a third of the woman that my mom is and have a third of the strength that she has, then I will have done good by this life.
author: Brittany Murphy

text: My mom was tough.
author: Tiger Woods

text: I'm a lioness. I have four cubs. I'm a mom. I want to take care of my kids and protect them.
author: Heidi Klum

text: I started cooking when I was about 10. I have memories like when I was 6 or 7 with my mom, and when I was 12 I started getting real serious about cooking.
author: Emeril Lagasse

text: One time my mom tried to ground me, but that lasted 15 minutes.
author: Bam Margera

text: My mom knows pretty well how I see her.
author: Lena Dunham

text: I'd never really babysat. I feel like I'm Blair, or 'Gossip Girl.' A teenager, basically - and now suddenly I'm a mom?
author: Cecily von Ziegesar

text: I deal with postpartum feelings by reaching out to mom friends. I became very close with some of the women in my prenatal yoga class.
author: Alyssa Milano

text: At 3 years old, I was imitating and doing fun little commercials for the family. Then at 5, I knew, 'OK, this is something I really like.' At 8, I was crying in front of the mirror and my mom was like, 'Oh boy, here we go. We know what she's going to do.'
author: Lana Parrilla

text: My nickname for my mom was 'The Compass.'
author: Dane Cook

text: My mom was a source of strength.She showed me by example that women, regardless of how difficult life may get, can do it all.
author: Gloria Estefan

text: My Mom said she learned how to swim when someone took her out in the lake and threw her off the boat. I said, 'Mom, they weren't trying to teach you how to swim.'
author: Paula Poundstone

text: I am a single mom and I'm the breadwinner and I have to work and I have to do these things and that's just the way it is. I don't think my son even knows any different.
author: Charisma Carpenter

text: I've had to adapt my wardrobe to my various roles, both at the office, as a mom, and for television. When I shop for the season I look for pieces that will suit every facet of my daily life, not just one single occasion.
author: Nina Garcia

text: I am a mom as well as a senator!
author: Patty Murray

text: Every single thing I learned about marketing and building my business, I learned from my mom, and she had never been in the workforce. She just had great practical sense.
author: Barbara Corcoran

text: Well, I am not really a conventional mom at all. Like, I had my kids really young. I had Danny when I was 18 or 19 and then Liam when I was 23 and Molly, I had when I was a little older.
author: Monica Potter

text: Always it gave me a pang that my children had no lawful claim to a name.
author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

text: My mom used to take me down to the Jersey Shore when I was 7, 8, 9 years old. I can remember being down in that area - Belmar, Seaside Heights, Asbury Park and all those places that I went back and revisited.
author: David Cassidy

text: Growing up with three older brothers and being the youngest and the only girl, my mom always made me tough. She's taught me over the years how to be a strong, independent woman, how to carry yourself in a positive way and anything that my brothers can do, I can do.
author: Diana Lopez

text: My mom will make me walk the dogs or take out the trash when I go home.
author: Queen Latifah

text: It's been very hard, after being mostly a mom, to develop an adult life of my own. And not being married anymore, I have to come up with challenges.
author: Danielle Steel

text: My father wasn't really involved and my mom is the light in my life.
author: Marion Jones

text: I'm proud of what I look like. I'm proud that I look like my mom.
author: Lisa Guerrero

text: We all seek approval, and our mother's seal is usually the most important. The nitty gritty is that we have to accept ourselves, even if it is just to be ready for the next cut-down. Mom's blessing or not.
author: Beth Ditto

text: We've all seen the mom who devotes all her time and attention to her child and is so hungry for adult interaction that as soon as she's around another adult, she's not paying attention anymore.
author: Cynthia Nixon

text: Who in their infinite wisdom decreed that Little League uniforms be white? Certainly not a mother.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: My mom and I have always been there for each other. We had some tough times, but she was always there for me.
author: LeBron James

text: My mom was very strict when I was growing up. I could not talk to boys until I was 18. I had to study and work hard.
author: Coco Lee

text: So much of our lives are defined by habit or what the guy next to us is doing, never wondering and knowing who and what we support with our actions, from the detergent Mom always used, to my favorite dish I make... A lot of my life is unexamined habit.
author: Kristin Bauer van Straten

text: I'm kind of lucky that we've finished shooting 'Cougar Town,' so I'm able to kind of just enjoy my pregnancy and be a stay-at-home mom and go to prenatal Pilates and do all that fun stuff that, if I were working, would be almost impossible to do.
author: Busy Philipps

text: An agent saw one of the plays I did at ACT, but my mom was like, No, she's too young. I became so annoying that a year and a half later she just couldn't stand hearing me any more!
author: Marla Sokoloff

text: I never let anyone pluck, including myself, unless my mom approves. She guards my eyebrows. She's like the eyebrow police!
author: Isabelle Fuhrman

text: My mom was onstage when she was pregnant with me.
author: Zosia Mamet

text: My mom and I have always been very close. She is my best friend. She had to make a lot of sacrifices early on in my life to make sure I got to do what I wanted to do.
author: Norah Jones

text: We've always loved going to the movies. Our mom and dad are big movie fans. They'd take us on these movie orgys where we'd see sometimes three movies in a day.
author: Andy Wachowski

text: My mom, she wasn't like a baseball mother who knew everything about the game. She just wanted me to be happy with what I was doing.
author: David Ortiz

text: My mom was a '70s mom. She paved a road that no one had yet walked.
author: Melissa Leo

text: My mom is still yelling at me because she needs more autographed pictures.
author: Ashton Kutcher

text: Isn't it so weird the day you wake up and you're just going with the flow? And you just suddenly are a mom.
author: Katherine Heigl

text: My mom sang in high school choir and so did my father.
author: Kevin Richardson

text: My mom didn't want me to go to college. She didn't want me to read - when I read, I may as well have been holding a pineapple.
author: Lynda Barry

text: I was two years old when my mom put me in mommy and me classes. I always had a lot of energy so it was the perfect fit!
author: Aly Raisman

text: My mom and I have always been really close. She's always been the friend that was always there. There were times when, in middle school and junior high, I didn't have a lot of friends. But my mom was always my friend. Always.
author: Taylor Swift

text: Why do grandparents and grandchildren get along so well? The mother.
author: Claudette Colbert

text: My mom has always said that if I get a big head, she'll take me out of this business as quickly as I got into it.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: AIDS can destroy a family if you let it, but luckily for my sister and me, Mom taught us to keep going. Don't give up, be proud of who you are, and never feel sorry for yourself.
author: Ryan White

text: It would be great to do another television show that was a multi-camera because the hours are so wonderful and you can be a good mom at the same time. The problem is, there aren't a lot of multi-camera shows that I personally like. My aesthetic is more geared toward single-camera shows.
author: Kaitlin Olson

text: My mom and I were super tight. I think she really wanted me to be an artist, you know? She used to like to tell people she wanted to be Beethoven's mother. That was her thing. She wanted to be the mother of this person.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

text: I'm a full-time mom right now and a part-time actress.
author: Valerie Bertinelli

text: No, my mom kind of led me toward acting. She wanted to be an actress when she was younger. That made me interested in it when I was a kid, because she and I are very close.
author: Stephen Colbert

text: My mom was scared of the old Times Square so I was never allowed to go. Now I'm scared of the new Times Square, so I still never go.
author: Padma Lakshmi

text: I was home-schooled, was always very close with my mom and was very straight-laced and square. I was never the rebellious one, and I never threw hissy fits.
author: Brie Larson

text: When I was seven, I asked my mom if I could be on TV, and she said if I really wanted to, I could. I got an agent and booked my first audition.
author: Natasha Calis

text: I was given baby doll toys myself, and they proved a stark reminder that my life was expected to revolve around childbearing - just as my mom's had before me, and her mom's had before her.
author: Beth Ditto

text: When I was a little girl, rocking my little dolls, I remember thinking I would be the world's best mom, and so far I've done it.
author: Jenny McCarthy

text: A guy is a lump like a doughnut. So, first you gotta get rid of all the stuff his mom did to him. And then you gotta get rid of all that macho crap that they pick up from beer commercials. And then there's my personal favorite, the male ego.
author: Roseanne Barr

text: My mom has always said that the one thing she wishes she had done differently is have a job. She felt like the single-mindedness made her a little nuts sometimes, and she could have used an outlet for herself when we were little.
author: Jennifer Garner

text: I think I've become more like my mom just because of what we're both interested in, children and teaching and writing.
author: Jenna Bush

text: I had no idea of the size of my bank account as a teen, and I didn't care to know. That was my mom's job, I figured that I would just find out when I turned 18. If you can't trust your mom, then who can you trust?
author: Anna Chlumsky

text: My mom was a seamstress, and I wish I'd learned to sew because I'm obsessed with 'Project Runway!'
author: Carmen Electra

text: Death can't be so bad if mom went through it. It makes it easier for the child to follow.
author: Danny Aiello

text: I grabbed my mom and I went to the couch and I said, 'Mom I want to ask Jesus to come into my heart.' And I got on my knee and I asked Jesus to come into my heart, forgive me of my sins, and make me a child of God.
author: Tim Tebow

text: My mom used to say that Greek Easter was later because then you get stuff cheaper.
author: Amy Sedaris

text: My mom didn't ever think I would take to acting because I was a very shy, very reserved kind of child. But obviously, something changed!
author: Abigail Breslin

text: My mom did costumes for the Pointer Sisters.
author: Slash

text: We always had 'Vogue' in our house. But, when I was around 12, my Mom finally took me seriously about modeling and put a stack of magazines in front of me, then told me to study all the poses. The ones I loved the most were in 'Vogue.'
author: Chanel Iman

text: I am proud of my kids, but I also want to make my mom proud of me. I'm still a momma's girl at the heart of the situation.
author: Tori Spelling

text: My mom was paranoid about my safety.
author: Jane Smiley

text: Mothers are the necessity of invention.
author: Bill Watterson

text: My earliest memory is seeing Michael Jackson in Melbourne with my sister when I was about ten. I still have this souvenir stick with a glove that would light up and make a peace sign in a bunch of different colors. I'm so happy my mom didn't throw that out.
author: Emilie de Ravin

text: I was a single mom that raised two bright, beautiful, and compassionate girls.
author: Connie Stevens

text: I gave guitar lessons. I tried to join bands. My mom always said it was obvious that nothing was going to stop me.
author: Janis Ian

text: For example, I loved English and history at school. I would have loved to have done a degree in either. But my Mom said I didn't have time for university.
author: Vanessa Mae

text: I'm looking forward to being a mom and a wife and a business owner.
author: Melanie Roach

text: Growing up my whole life, my mom was telling me how incredible and special I was and that I was going to change the world. I think it's important for girls to know that they can change the world, that they do have an impact.
author: Ashley Greene

text: There is nothing I love more than my role as a mom.
author: Jennifer Hudson

text: This is the place where anybody - like an African American kid raised by a single mom - can be president.
author: Jennifer M. Granholm

text: I stand fearlessly for small dogs, the American Flag, motherhood and the Bible. That's why people love me.
author: Art Linkletter

text: I'm not sure what I want to do when I grow up, or if I'm sure I ever want to grow up. I'm sure there are people that wish I would, but you know, my mom will get over it.
author: Jerry Doyle

text: But my mother and father were married when my mom was 20 and my dad was 24.
author: Rachael Leigh Cook

text: My mom, she's from Ireland, coached tennis in Nigeria when she was a missionary and turned me on to it when I was young.
author: Donal Logue

text: I want to make sure I continue to make good music that my mom and everybody around me can be proud of.
author: Ruben Studdard

text: My mom was a single mom, and she had enough on her plate. I knew when I was doing something I wasn't supposed to, and I tried to keep her from finding out about it. I did a pretty good job of that.
author: Jason Aldean

text: I make a lot of mistakes, too, and I'm constantly re-evaluating how I'm doing things and trying to be better every day, whether it's as a mom or taking care of myself.
author: Mia Hamm

text: I wish my mother had left me something about how she felt growing up. I wish my grandmother had done the same. I wanted my girls to know me.
author: Carol Burnett

text: I also think a Hot Mom is someone who can connect with what's current in her kids' world.
author: Jami Gertz

text: I remember when I was 11, I told my mom, 'One day I'm going to buy you a house.' And she said, 'Boy, don't you be making promises you can't keep.' I was like: 'No, Ma, it's not a promise. I'm going to buy you a house one day.'
author: will.i.am

text: The rule with my mom was that the only way that I could be an actress when I was young was that I continued to go to public school and get straight A's in all my classes.
author: Sara Paxton

text: Once my mom passed away, I have nobody to answer to. It's great.
author: Jessica Hahn

text: Postpartum depression is a very real and very serious problem for many mothers. It can happen to a first time mom or a veteran mother. It can occur a few days... or a few months after childbirth.
author: Richard J. Codey

text: Mom and Pop were just a couple of kids when they got married. He was eighteen, she was sixteen and I was three.
author: Billie Holiday

text: I was 3 when I told my mom that I knew what my dharma was and that I wanted to be an actor.
author: Brie Larson

text: My mom had gotten a Super 8 camera to make home movies with, and my brother and me got our hands on it and ran with it.
author: Lev Yilmaz

text: I love every second of being a mom.
author: Lily Aldridge

text: I took piano for many years. I kicked and screamed through all of my lessons, but my mom really insisted.
author: Kristin Kreuk

text: I prefer to imagine that my wife, a few friends, and occasionally my mom are the only ones who read what I do, though I realize that this is somewhat unrealistic.
author: Chris Ware

text: Being a singer is all about me. About ego. Being a mom is all about being selfless - two different worlds.
author: Gwen Stefani

text: It was my mom and I against the world. We lived in New York in this bohemian lifestyle where an extended group of artists and photographers were like my aunts and uncles.
author: Brooke Shields

text: My father still is a lawyer, and my mom was a teacher and then later a career counselor.
author: Steve Case

text: My mom still lives in Denver and some of my brothers are still in the area, so I still have strong ties there.
author: Terrell Davis

text: My mom said, 'Don't get married. You're too young. Go out there and experience what life has to offer.' And I did.
author: Emmitt Smith

text: As a mom I know that raising children is the hardest job there is.
author: Hilary Rosen

text: When I'm in the gym, I'm in the gym, and that is my focus. But when I'm not in the gym, I'm enjoying being a mom and taking care of those responsibilities .. They really do provide me with the balance that I need to be a more complete athlete.
author: Melanie Roach

text: My mom was a photographer and whenever they needed a baby for a modelling job, she'd stick me in front of the camera. That's how it started.
author: Alyson Hannigan

text: I'm a soccer mom. I'm T-ball, soccer, karate, homework, keeping them on their schedules. I love being the snack mom, when I get to bring the cut oranges. I have one of those coolers with wheels. I'm at every game, every practice, sitting on my blanket. I love it.
author: Pamela Anderson

text: I think my love of journalizing my life comes from my mom.
author: Jeff Bridges

text: I was class mom at the preschool one year and I was pretty much asked not to do that again!
author: Julie Bowen

text: I showed my mom the movie then I told her the movie got bought and that it was gonna be shown in theatres and be on video. Everyone was really psyched about it. Everyone in my little town of hounds started to call me movie star.
author: Jason Mewes

text: My mother kept asking me, 'When are you going to do a gospel album?' And I've always wanted to do a gospel album. Everybody was going on about it, so mom started hounding me more.
author: Alan Jackson

text: I look up to my mom. She's a beautiful woman.
author: Leighton Meester

text: My mom was dying for me to write a book, she was my biggest advocate.
author: Victor Cruz

text: I think a good mom is an awake mom. At least for me, I've always been a kinder, better person awake than sleep-deprived!
author: Lisa Loeb

text: I had to take my makeup off at work every night. I wasn't allowed to do it at home because my mom said that when your work day is done, you're done with work.
author: Jodie Foster

text: Last time I spoke to my mom she called me from a pay phone, and we didn't have the best talk. Ever since my stepdad passed away three years ago, she has been very depressed and hasn't been herself at all.
author: Eric West

text: Naturally, people are curious about how my real mom feels about me having a TV mom.
author: Rico Rodriguez

text: I told my mom, 'I'm not buying another magazine until I can get past this thought of looking like the girl on the cover'. She said, "Miley, you are the girl on the cover,' and I was, like, 'I know, but I don't feel like that girl every day.' You can't always feel perfect.
author: Miley Cyrus

text: It's impossible to put yourself first when you're a mom.
author: Jillian Michaels

text: I've always wanted to be an actress, ever since I was a little girl. I always played the mom and I played my sister as the daughter. I wanted to be an actress on television and movies instead of just around the house.
author: Dakota Fanning

text: My mom insisted on multigrain bread and never allowed soda in the house.
author: Vin Diesel

text: Aretha Franklin was a teenage mom, a musician who came from an incredibly Christian background, but there was a lot of love, which is really inspiring in a feminist way.
author: Beth Ditto

text: My mom has this great skiing event in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, every year for a local charity.
author: Joely Fisher

text: I don't drink, and I don't smoke. It's a personal preference. My mom has never drunk or smoked. I look up to my mom.
author: Ashley Tisdale

text: I would forgive my mom, but she's going to have to admit she did some things that were wrong.
author: Aaron Carter

text: I love Westerns and I remember as a kid climbing up on the couch and make it into a saddle and shoot guns and fall off. I would lay there after my death and my mom would tell me to eat lunch and I'd say, 'I'm still dead, Mom!' I was Method, even then.
author: Creed Bratton

text: My mom was a saint. She taught me to be terminally nice.
author: Iggy Pop

text: Motherhood has a very humanizing effect. Everything gets reduced to essentials.
author: Meryl Streep

text: Grades were important in our house. I was reading by two. My mom would sit there and read with me, read with me, read with me. It was wonderful.
author: Fergie

text: And the greatest lesson that mom ever taught me though was this one. She told me there would be times in your life when you have to choose between being loved and being respected. Now she said to always pick being respected.
author: Chris Christie

text: It is only in the act of nursing that a woman realizes her motherhood in visible and tangible fashion it is a joy of every moment.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: I don't have to do a lot to my eyebrows. My mom always told me not to pluck them, which is great advice.
author: Arizona Muse

text: President Obama's fight for rural America is personal. He was raised by a single mom and grandparents from Kansas. He hails from a farming state, Illinois.
author: Tom Vilsack

text: My mom and dad are both in stand-up comedy, so that's where I started, that's where I got everything. My roots are holding the mic.
author: Pauly Shore

text: As a mom, I always feel I have to protect them. I talk about them because they are the most important things in my life but they are private people. I won't use them for my own press.
author: Jami Gertz

text: I always tell people, I'm a better swimmer because I'm a mom and a better mom because I'm swimmer.
author: Amanda Beard

text: My mom and my dad wanted my brother and I to have a better life, you know, better education, better jobs. It was probably harder, much, much harder, for my parents. When you're a kid, you can learn a language much more easily I learned English in less than a year.
author: Mila Kunis

text: My mom's gonna be the biggest star - mark my words right now!
author: Vinny Guadagnino

text: Thankfully, I have my mom and a small group of close friends who are there for me 24/7 and whom I can trust and depend on.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: For everything I do, I think about a 6-year-old girl and her mom that I saw at my concert last night. I think about what those two individuals would think if I were at a club last night. I never want to be arrested, and I never want to get a DUI, those are my moral values.
author: Taylor Swift

text: My mom decorated with lots of antiques. I never liked it when I was a little girl - I wanted to live in a modern house. But now I love it.
author: Paris Hilton

text: My mom and I have always had issues.
author: Mindy McCready

text: I'm really happy to be a mom, and I'm proud of the phase I'm in.
author: Liz Phair

text: My mom, she's a breast cancer survivor and because of that I had started getting mammograms once a year, starting at age 30.
author: Kate Walsh

text: My mom was sarcastic about men. She would tell me Adam was the rough draft and Eve was the final product. She was a feminist minister, an earth mom who wore a bra only on Sundays.
author: Daphne Zuniga

text: Fortunately, when you're a mom, the responsibility of caring for your child can keep you going.
author: Shania Twain

text: I lived with my mom in a really small apartment. My bedroom was like in the living room. That's why I still love to sleep on couches now.
author: Alicia Keys

text: I remember watching the Grammys and looking at the performances and crying to my mom, saying how much I wanted to be there.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: When I was 7, I came up with the idea of 'charm socks.' My mom would take me to buy bags of plastic charms, we would sew them on frilly white socks, and I sold them at school.
author: Sara Blakely

text: I like to work. The self-esteem and satisfaction that I get from working makes me a better person, which makes me a better mom. I feel lucky because I have the luxury of working only one or two days a week.
author: Cindy Crawford

text: I was brought up as an only child, and we were very close. But when I was 14, we got evicted. We came home to a padlock, and I looked up at my mom and she was crying, and there was nothing to do.
author: Dwayne Johnson

text: There was a point - when I was a kid - where I said I wanted to be like Luke Skywalker, with blond hair and blue eyes. My mom right there told me to never be ashamed of who I am.
author: Chaske Spencer

text: Being a mom's so empowering and incredible. I'm one of those people who believes that life brings things to you at a certain time for a certain reason, and if you just go with it, that's where the best moments come from.
author: Ashlee Simpson

text: I love my mom. My mom loves me. We don't have an easy relationship. I don't think we ever will, but I'd rather have a complicated, misunderstood relationship than have no relationship at all.
author: Tori Spelling

text: There's a book called 'The Shack' - it had a lot to do with me coming full circle, meeting my birth mother. Awhile back, my birth mom and my adopted mom came to my show together, and it was pretty surreal.
author: Rodney Atkins

text: I've always wanted to be a mom.
author: Holly Madison

text: I want to go to college to study journalism. I want to speak French fluently, to travel. My mom was a journalist and it's in my blood.
author: Mandy Moore

text: We never had a bathtub. Mom would bathe me in the wooden or tin washtub in the kitchen, or in a big lard can.
author: Ethel Waters

text: My whole life sort of ended when my mom died.
author: Cheryl Strayed

text: I am excited to rise today to support National Mom and Pop Business Owners Day. This celebration honors the husband and wife business owner teams whose work helps drive the economy and fuel job growth.
author: Melissa Bean

text: It's superfun being a mom, but it's hard too.
author: Gwen Stefani

text: I have lots of records, quite a collection, actually, that I stole from my mom. I have the original 'Thriller' album and I have a really great 'Elton John's Greatest Hits,' and I also have a N.E.R.D. album. Records sound more original. They have more edge.
author: Elisha Cuthbert

text: My mom is many times responsible for getting us all together, but we trade off at each other's houses. My brother and I are actors and are traveling a lot of our job.
author: Beau Bridges

text: The first few weeks of being a mom were profound, not just emotionally but also, physically. All the changes you instinctually go through are miraculous.
author: Alyssa Milano

text: My mom is very Southern and she in real life says things like, 'If you've got it, flaunt it.'
author: Cheryl Hines

text: I suddenly had this really mad desire to have an affair with a woman. I was divorced. I was childless. I figured there's got to be one more way to really tick off my mom.
author: Carol Leifer

text: Mom spent the time that she was supposed to be a kid actully raising children, her younger brother and younger sister. She was tough as nails and did not suffer fools at all. And the truth was she could not afford to. She spoke the truth, bluntly, directly, and without much varnish. I am her son.
author: Chris Christie

text: I don't want to have kids for like 10 years. I still have a lot to do. I don't even know if I could handle a dog right now. I'm so not ready. Someday I'll be a mom but not until I'm in my 30s.
author: Avril Lavigne

text: Well, my mom is single and we've both been single at the same time over the last ten years, so I really related to the bond between my character and Diane's.
author: Amanda Peet

text: I hope that through my work, artists will take some chances, break some rules, and make art that comes from inside of them. I would like to be remembered as a kind person, a great Mom, and a bit unruly - in a good way!
author: Angela Cartwright

text: I've always been homeschooled, so doing it on set is kind of the same thing. My mom makes it very interactive - we'll get a book on chocolate and learn how to make it, or she will buy antique items. I love military history, the mechanics and strategy of it.
author: Atticus Shaffer

text: I'd say that if you had a strained relationship with your mom, for whatever reason, the best thing to do is be open with each other, talk it over, try and work it out somehow as opposed to just putting a wall up and pushing them away.
author: Victoria Justice

text: President Obama likes to talk about the Buffett Rule. Well, here's a Buffett Rule that all Americans should be able to support: mom and pop businesses should not pay a higher tax rate than Fortune 500 corporations like Warren Buffett's.
author: Rob Portman

text: When I was little, my mom tells me, I used to say things like, 'Mom do you hear the string section? Do you hear the string section?' And she would look at me and say, 'No honey, I don't know what you're talking about.'
author: Tori Amos

text: My mom was Sicilian, my dad was Sicilian. Mom was a great cook, but all the women were.
author: Chazz Palminteri

text: My mom being a psychotherapist, I've been brought up with that whole psychoanalytical terrain.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

text: I got my first tattoo when I was 16 years old and I went with my mom to get it done - she has a bunch too so we're tattoo buddies now.
author: Josh Hutcherson

text: I have so much respect for my mom and all the women across the world.
author: Jessica Simpson

text: But the fact is, I'm not work-identified. I'm not a lawyer or a writer. I'm a mom, and I'm a woman, and that's the kind of people I want to see in books in the starring role.
author: Lisa Scottoline

text: My mom doesn't get the whole gay thing, but she loves me.
author: Jai Rodriguez

text: I love my mom. I totally look up to her, and she just doesn't let anybody take advantage of me. People might call that a stage mom.
author: Hilary Duff

text: When Queer Eye hit, the church told my mom they were praying for me. She said, God loves him too. And I support him 100 percent.
author: Jai Rodriguez

text: My mom and I used to listen to records, read, and take train rides across the country in the summer. It was a very chill life. She didn't expose me to anything that was ahead of my development, but she expected me to adjust to her world - she did not expect to adjust to mine.
author: Martha Plimpton

text: My mom was a great cook and great baker all her life.
author: Mandy Patinkin

text: My mom was a diabetic. Her sister was a diabetic, so I was already a candidate.
author: Angie Stone

text: I had such a great mom and I know that I'd never be that mom. I wouldn't want to bring a child into this world unless I could be.
author: Lara Flynn Boyle

text: If I have any talent at all it's from God, and my mom, who was on Capitol Records also.
author: Garth Brooks

text: Every man must define his identity against his mother. If he does not, he just falls back into her and is swallowed up.
author: Camille Paglia

text: It's always been my mom and I against the world.
author: Brittany Murphy

text: I am sure that if the mothers of various nations could meet, there would be no more wars.
author: E. M. Forster

text: I've been an atheist since I was nine years old. And my mom is really religious, so we have a strange relationship. But if my mother was right, what would be the reason that the gods could let anything bad happen in the world?
author: Tarsem Singh

text: I'm a competitive person and it is in my nature to try hard in every match I play. The only time I'm not competitive is when I'm playing against my mom.
author: Michael Chang

text: The natural state of motherhood is unselfishness. When you become a mother, you are no longer the center of your own universe. You relinquish that position to your children.
author: Jessica Lange

text: I think if I could be any superhero, it'd probably be my mom... but I don't think I'd look too good in high heels, so it's not gonna happen.
author: Jason Behr

text: My mom is a constant in my life in so many ways.
author: Kerri Walsh

text: Not to be weird, but I still have an ongoing relationship with my mom, even though she passed away, and I've been surprised at how much I've been able to convey to her. Now I sound like a total weirdo, but that's true.
author: Mindy Kaling

text: I think it would be a lot easier if I said, 'I feel like a dude,' but I was raised by a southern mom, so I know how to put on lipstick and walk in heels and rock that look. It's exactly that juxtaposition that confuses people.
author: Saskia de Brauw

text: I got tackled once in a movie theater. I was with my mom and brother, and then suddenly I got hit from behind and sort of sprawled out on the candy counter.
author: Scott Wolf
